English: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
Bahnar: Âu boih roi gah tơm hmơm tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng Yêsu Krist, Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei

English: As it is written in the Prophets: “Behold, I send My messenger before Your face, Who will prepare Your way before You.”
Bahnar: Êsai, bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆, sư khan lê̆ hơdrol, na chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar sư thoi âu: 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Âu Inh wơh minh 'nu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Inh hơdrol, wă kơ sư hơmet trong kơ Ih.”

English: “The voice of one crying in the wilderness: ‘Prepare the way of the LORD; Make His paths straight.’ ”
Bahnar: Bơngai ei bơtho tơ char glă thoi âu: “Bơ̆n tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch wă khan bĕ hơmet trong kơ Kră Yang păng pơm trong Sư mă tơpăt.”

English: John came baptizing in the wilderness and preaching a baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'noh 'blep tơpă: Yôhan năm pơm 'batem kơ đe tơ char glă chơngue, sư bơtho athei đe tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch, na iŏk 'batem wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih yoch sư.

English: Then all the land of Judea, and those from Jerusalem, went out to him and were all baptized by him in the Jordan River, confessing their sins.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai đơ̆ng dêh Juđê hăm đĭ-đăng bơngai lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem năm tơ Yôhan. Lu sư roi kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơdrong yoch lu sư, na Yôhan pơm 'batem kơ lu sư tơ krong Jôrđăn.

English: Now John was clothed with camel’s hair and with a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.
Bahnar: Yôhan hrŭk ao tanh păng sŏk aseh lăk-đa păng tah gơ'năm akar tơ bơnei sư. Tơmam sa sư lep păng đak sut bri đĕch.

English: And he preached, saying, “There comes One after me who is mightier than I, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to stoop down and loose.
Bahnar: Sư bơtho đe khan: “Đei minh 'nu bơngai gô truh đơ̆ng rŏng kơ inh, Sư 'Bok tih tơpă. Mă khan Sư athei inh yaih ăn tơlei chơkhŏ Sư đĕch inh kư̆m ưh kơ hơnhŏ 'mơ̆i, inh ưh kơ pơ̆n ngơk lăng Sư ôh.

English: I indeed baptized you with water, but He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.”
Bahnar: Inh pơm kơ iĕm 'batem păng đak mă-lei Sư pơm kơ iĕm 'batem hăm Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng.”

English: It came to pass in those days that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized by John in the Jordan.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Yêsu truh đơ̆ng Pơlei Nasaret dêh Galilê, na Yôhan pơm 'batem kơ Sư lăm đak krong Jôrđăn.

English: And immediately, coming up from the water, He saw the heavens parting and the Spirit descending upon Him like a dove.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu tŏk đơ̆ng đak, Sư 'bôh hloi plĕnh tơpơih păng Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng thoi lĕ sem kơtơp jur oei tơ Sư.

English: Then a voice came from heaven, “You are My beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”
Bahnar: Păng kư̆m đei nơ̆r pơma đơ̆ng plĕnh khan: “Ih boih Kon Inh mă 'mêm kơeng tơpă, Inh lăp đon kơ Ih tôm tơdrong.”

English: Immediately the Spirit drove Him into the wilderness.
Bahnar: Na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng anhăk hloi Yêsu năm tơ char glă chơngue.

English: And He was there in the wilderness forty days, tempted by Satan, and was with the wild beasts; and the angels ministered to Him.
Bahnar: Sư oei tơ char glă ei puăn-jĭt năr na yang Satan năm pơhlŭ Sư. Sư oei păng kon sem bri brah đĕch, linh jang 'lơ̆ng đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei chă awih awăn kơ Sư tơmam sa.

English: Now after John was put in prison, Jesus came to Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God
Bahnar: Lăp đơ̆ng rŏng kơ đe phak Yôhan, Yêsu năm tơ dêh Galilê chă bơtho đe tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: and saying, “The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand. Repent, and believe in the gospel.”
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Năr âu trŏ kơ năr 'Bok Kei-Dei wă pơgơ̆r iĕm boih. Iĕm athei tơbral kơdih tôm tơdrong yoch iĕm, na lui kiơ̆ tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng Sư.”

English: And as He walked by the Sea of Galilee, He saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea; for they were fishermen.
Bahnar: Kơplah Sư năm kiơ̆ ter jih đak dơsĭ Galilê Sư 'bôh bre Simôn păng oh sư Andrê oei traih jal chă ka tơ đak dơsĭ, yua kơ bre sư bơngai juăt kơ chă ka ling-lang.

English: Then Jesus said to them, “Follow Me, and I will make you become fishers of men.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ bre sư thoi âu: “Bĕ bơ̆n kiơ̆ Inh, na Inh pơchĕp ăn kơ biĕm tơdrong jang chă bơngai lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: They immediately left their nets and followed Him.
Bahnar: Na bre sư 'blă achăng lê̆ jal bre sư, na kiơ̆ hloi Yêsu.

English: When He had gone a little farther from there, He saw James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, who also were in the boat mending their nets.
Bahnar: Lu sư yak ataih 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng noh, Sư 'bôh bre Yakơ păng oh sư Yôhan kon Sêbêđê. Bre sư oei hrăk ming jal tơ thŏng-nan.

English: And immediately He called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired servants, and went after Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu krao bre sư, na bre sư kiơ̆ hloi Yêsu, lê̆ 'bă sư păng lu bơngai bơ̆jang kơ sư tơ thŏng-nan.

English: Then they went into Capernaum, and immediately on the Sabbath He entered the synagogue and taught.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lu sư năm tơ Pơlei Kapernum. Kơplah năr pơdơh Sa'bat, Yêsu năm akŭm tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei păng bơtho đe tơ noh.

English: And they were astonished at His teaching, for He taught them as one having authority, and not as the scribes.
Bahnar: Đe mơ̆ng chrêu kơ đon, yua kơ dôm nơ̆r Sư bơtho gơh hơgei tơpă, ưh kơ thoi lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt lu đe Juđê chă bơtho đe.

English: Now there was a man in their synagogue with an unclean spirit. And he cried out
Bahnar: Kơplah ei đei minh 'nu bơngai yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t kư̆m mơ̆t tơ hnam ei. Sư pơma 'bơ̆r re khan

English: saying, “Let us alone! What have we to do with You, Jesus of Nazareth? Did You come to destroy us? I know who You are—the Holy One of God!”
Bahnar: “Ơ Yêsu đơ̆ng Pơlei Nasaret, Ih wă pơm kiơ kơ khŭl nhôn? Ih năm tơ âu wă pơrăm khŭl nhôn hă? Inh băt kơ Ih, Ih 'Bok 'Lơ̆ng Tơpăt đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: But Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet, and come out of him!”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khă yang kơnê̆ ei thoi âu: “E 'nĕ pă pơma, e jah lĕch đơ̆ng akâu sư âu wăi.”

English: And when the unclean spirit had convulsed him and cried out with a loud voice, he came out of him.
Bahnar: Na yang kơnê̆ ei pơm kơ sư pơtơ̆l, pơma pơret, na lĕch jăk hloi đơ̆ng bơngai ei.

English: Then they were all amazed, so that they questioned among themselves, saying, “What is this? What new doctrine is this? For with authority He commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey Him.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na đĭ-đăng bơngai 'bôh Sư pơm thoi noh, lu sư sơleng kơ đon na sư tơjet dih băl khan: “Sư bơtho tơdrong kiơ âu kih? Sư bơtho tơdrong 'nao dah kiơ, na Sư gơh pơpuh yang kơnê̆, na yang kơnê̆ chu Sư?”

English: And immediately His fame spread throughout all the region around Galilee.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Yêsu pơm thoi noh, na đe kơtơ̆ng ang tơdrong Sư jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh Galilê hloi.

English: Now as soon as they had come out of the synagogue, they entered the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
Bahnar: Yêsu lĕch đơ̆ng hnam akŭm ei năm tơ hnam bre Simôn păng Andrê. Bre Yakơ păng Yôhan kư̆m kiơ̆ Sư mơ̆n.

English: But Simon’s wife’s mother lay sick with a fever, and they told Him about her at once.
Bahnar: Na tơnei Simôn oei păn kơ bơlŏ na đe khan kơ Yêsu.

English: So He came and took her by the hand and lifted her up, and immediately the fever left her. And she served them.
Bahnar: Yêsu năm jê̆ sư hiot tơiung sư. Kơtă ei sư klaih hloi kơ bơlŏ, na sư chă awih awăn kơ đe Yêsu.

English: At evening, when the sun had set, they brought to Him all who were sick and those who were demon-possessed.
Bahnar: Lăp 'năr mơ̆t adrơ̆m kơsơ̆ ei đe năm ba tơ sư dôm lu bơngai jĭ jăn păng lu bơngai yang mơ̆t.

English: And the whole city was gathered together at the door.
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lăm pơlei ei akŭm 'bơ̆t cham hnam Simôn păng Andrê.

English: Then He healed many who were sick with various diseases, and cast out many demons; and He did not allow the demons to speak, because they knew Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu pơklaih lơ bơngai jĭ jăn păng pơpuh lu yang kơnê̆ mă mơ̆t lăm bơngai. Sư khă lu yang kơnê̆ pơma tơbăt Sư kơ đe kơlih kơ lu yang ei băt kơ Sư.

English: Now in the morning, having risen a long while before daylight, He went out and departed to a solitary place; and there He prayed.
Bahnar: Lăp pơgê hrôih năr đơ̆ng rŏng, Yêsu lĕch hloi đơ̆ng pơlei ei năm tơ anih kueng kơdrô̆, Sư krao khan kơdrô̆ Sư tơ ei.

English: And Simon and those who were with Him searched for Him.
Bahnar: Đe Simôn chă Sư.

English: When they found Him, they said to Him, “Everyone is looking for You.”
Bahnar: Chă Sư 'bôh boih na khan: “Đei lơ bơngai chă Ih.”

English: But He said to them, “Let us go into the next towns, that I may preach there also, because for this purpose I have come forth.”
Bahnar: Na Sư khan kơ đe Simôn: “Bĕ bơ̆n năm jơ̆p pơlei kiơ̆ âu wă kơ Inh gơh chă bơtho lu sư, kơlih kơ tơdrong noh na Inh năm tơ âu.”

English: And He was preaching in their synagogues throughout all Galilee, and casting out demons.
Bahnar: Na Sư năm jơ̆p kơ dêh Galilê chă bơtho tơ lu hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei păng pơpuh lu yang kơnê̆ đơ̆ng lăm akâu bơngai mơ̆n.

English: Now a leper came to Him, imploring Him, kneeling down to Him and saying to Him, “If You are willing, You can make me clean.”
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai jĭ chin năm apinh Yêsu pơklaih sư. Sư sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng apinh khan: “Dah Ih wă, Ih gơh pơklaih inh.”

English: Then Jesus, moved with compassion, stretched out His hand and touched him, and said to him, “I am willing; be cleansed.”
Bahnar: Yêsu lăng mơnat kơ bơngai 'noh na chro ti pel bơngai 'noh păng khan: “Inh wă tơpă pơklaih ih, Inh pơklaih ih dang ei.”

English: As soon as He had spoken, immediately the leprosy left him, and he was cleansed.
Bahnar: Na bơngai jĭ ei klaih kơtă hloi.

English: And He strictly warned him and sent him away at once
Bahnar: Yêsu athei sư jah năm tơ 'bok soi păng khă sư hăm nơ̆r tơdrăp

English: and said to him, “See that you say nothing to anyone; but go your way, show yourself to the priest, and offer for your cleansing those things which Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”
Bahnar: “Ih 'nĕ chă roi kơ đe hŏ. Dang ei ih klaih boih na ih năm tơ'bôh akâu ih kơ 'bok soi păng soi sơmah kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kiơ̆ thoi Môis pơkă sơ̆ wă kơ đe băt tơdrong jĭ ih klaih tơpă boih.”

English: However, he went out and began to proclaim it freely, and to spread the matter, so that Jesus could no longer openly enter the city, but was outside in deserted places; and they came to Him from every direction.
Bahnar: Mă-lei bơngai 'noh lĕch, sư chă roi kơ đe. Mă sư năm tơ yơ yơ kư̆m roi kơ đe tơdrong 'noh mơ̆n. Na Yêsu jing ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t mă pơlei tơ yơ yơ yua kơ kon pơlei pơla chă Sư lơ tơpă. Na Sư oei hơdai hăm lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư tơ anih kueng kơdrô̆. Mă-lei jơ̆p tơring tơrang oei năm chă Sư 'mơ̆i.

English: And again He entered Capernaum after some days, and it was heard that He was in the house.
Bahnar: Lăp 'bar pêng năr đơ̆ng rŏng dơ̆ng, Yêsu wih tơ Pơlei Kapernum na đe kơtơ̆ng ang Sư oei hnam

English: Immediately many gathered together, so that there was no longer room to receive them, not even near the door. And He preached the word to them.
Bahnar: na mă lơ bơngai năm tơ hnam Sư păng kiơ̆ 'ngoaih 'măng Sư kư̆m ưh kơ đei anih rơwơn. Na Sư bơtho nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei kơ đe ei.

English: Then they came to Him, bringing a paralytic who was carried by four men.
Bahnar: Đe tung ba minh 'nu bơngai hơwen hơwo kơpal anhŭn anhăk tơ Yêsu. Đei puăn 'nu bơngai tung sư.

English: And when they could not come near Him because of the crowd, they uncovered the roof where He was. So when they had broken through, they let down the bed on which the paralytic was lying.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t ôh yua kơ đei lơ bơngai dêh lăm hnam ei. Na lu sư tŏk kung tŏk truh tơ bơbŭng hnam ei. Lu sư bŏk bơbŭng hnam ei tơklă Yêsu, tơjur bơngai hơwen ei păng anhŭn 'bơ̆t anăp Yêsu.

English: When Jesus saw their faith, He said to the paralytic, “Son, your sins are forgiven you.”
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu 'bôh lu sư đei đon lui thoi noh, na Sư khan kơ bơngai hơwen ei: “Ơ dăm, tơdrong yoch ih Inh pơklaih đĭ boih.”

English: And some of the scribes were sitting there and reasoning in their hearts
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê oei lăm ei. Lu sư kơtơ̆ng Yêsu pơma thoi noh na lu sư chă mơmơnh lăm đon khan

English: “Why does this Man speak blasphemies like this? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
Bahnar: “Yua kơ kiơ bơngai 'nâu pơma thoi noh? Sư pơma blông kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Bu mă gơh pơklaih yoch bơ̆n? Pôm 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch gơh pơklaih yoch bơ̆n.”

English: But immediately, when Jesus perceived in His spirit that they reasoned thus within themselves, He said to them, “Why do you reason about these things in your hearts?
Bahnar: Yêsu băt hloi kơ lu sư pơma mơmơnh lăm đon lu sư, jô̆ kơ Sư tơdrong 'noh, na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Yua kơ kiơ iĕm pơma mơmơnh lăm đon thoi noh lĕ?

English: Which is easier, to say to the paralytic, ‘Your sins are forgiven you,’ or to say, ‘Arise, take up your bed and walk’?
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ bơngai hơwen hơwo âu, tơdrong yoch sư Inh pơklaih đĭ boih, tơdrong 'noh dah iĕm 'bôh Inh athei sư iung, iŏk anhŭn sư chĕp brŏk, na sư iung brŏk hloi, 'noh iĕm kư̆m băt kơ Inh gơh pơklaih yoch sư mơ̆n. Na iĕm pơma mơmơnh kơ kiơ khan Inh pơma blông?

English: But that you may know that the Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins”—He said to the paralytic
Bahnar: Na dang ei Inh wă pơklaih jĭ sư wă tơ'bôh ăn kơ iĕm 'bôh Inh, Kon Bơngai, gơh pơklaih tơdrong yoch kon bơngai ala teh âu.” Na Yêsu khan kơ bơngai hơwen hơwo ei thoi âu

English: “I say to you, arise, take up your bed, and go to your house.”
Bahnar: “Inh khan kơ ih, jah iung bĕ chĕp anhŭn ih brŏk tơ hnam.”

English: Immediately he arose, took up the bed, and went out in the presence of them all, so that all were amazed and glorified God, saying, “We never saw anything like this!”
Bahnar: Sư iung hloi iŏk anhŭn sư lĕch brŏk 'bơ̆t anăp đe tơpôl lơ. Thoi noh na đĭ-đăng lu bơngai oei kiơ̆ ei 'bôh hlĭch tơpă păng ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Đơ̆ng sơ̆ bơ̆n tam 'bôh ôh tơdrong thoi âu iih?”

English: Then He went out again by the sea; and all the multitude came to Him, and He taught them.
Bahnar: Yêsu năm dơ̆ng tơ jih đak dơsĭ. Kư̆m đei lơ bơngai năm tơ Sư, na Sư bơtho đe.

English: As He passed by, He saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax office. And He said to him, “Follow Me.” So he arose and followed Him.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh, lăp lu Sư yak ataih 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng anih noh, na lu sư 'bôh hloi Lêwi kon Alphê oei jang 'bơ̆t hnam thuê̆. Na Yêsu pơtơm sư khan: “Bĕ kiơ̆ Inh.” Na Lêwi gruih iung kiơ̆ hloi Yêsu.

English: Now it happened, as He was dining in Levi’s house, that many tax collectors and sinners also sat together with Jesus and His disciples; for there were many, and they followed Him.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na Yêsu năm sŏng sa tơ hnam Lêwi. Tơ ei kư̆m đei lơ bơngai iŏk jên thuê̆ hăm bơngai pơm yoch kư̆m sŏng sa hơdai Yêsu hăm lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư, kơlih kơ lu bơngai iŏk jên thuê̆ păng lu bơngai yoch noh kiơ̆ Yêsu.

English: And when the scribes and Pharisees saw Him eating with the tax collectors and sinners, they said to His disciples, “How is it that He eats and drinks with tax collectors and sinners?”
Bahnar: Na lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê gah khŭl đe Pharisi 'bôh Yêsu sŏng sa hơdai lu đe noh, na lu sư jet lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu: “Kơlih kơ kiơ Yêsu Sư sŏng sa hơdai lu bơngai iŏk jên thuê̆ hăm lu bơngai pơm yoch?”

English: When Jesus heard it, He said to them, “Those who are well have no need of a physician, but those who are sick. I did not come to call the righteous, but sinners, to repentance.”
Bahnar: Yêsu kơtơ̆ng hloi lu sư pơma thoi noh, na Sư khan kơ lu 'bok thây ei: “Lu bơngai liĕm akâu ưh kơ kăl kơ 'bok pơgang ôh, pôm lu bơngai jĭ jăn đĕch kăl kơ 'bok pơgang. Inh năm tơ âu ưh kơ sĭ chă wơ̆n lu bơngai 'lơ̆ng ôh. Inh năm tơ âu wă wơ̆n chă lu bơngai yoch wă kơ sư tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch sư.”

English: The disciples of John and of the Pharisees were fasting. Then they came and said to Him, “Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but Your disciples do not fast?”
Bahnar: Kơplah ei lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yôhan hăm lu bơngai Pharisi oei ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa. Lu sư pơrơ̆ng ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa yua wă kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Na đe jet Yêsu thoi âu: “Liơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yôhan hăm lu bơngai Pharisi ơ̆t kơ por, mă lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Ih ưh kơ ơ̆t?”

English: And Jesus said to them, “Can the friends of the bridegroom fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them they cannot fast.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu pơma pơtih gia kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Kơplah đe pơkong kơ bơngai mă iŏk akăn, lu bôl bơngai mă iŏk akăn noh, lu sư ưh kơ đei bu ơh sơ'ngon ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa ôh.

English: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast in those days.
Bahnar: Pôm ning-mônh đĕch lăp đe anhăk bơngai mă iŏk akăn noh đơ̆ng bôl sư, 'bơ̆t ei kơnh trŏ kơ lu bôl sư ơh sơ'ngon ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa.

English: No one sews a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment; or else the new piece pulls away from the old, and the tear is made worse.
Bahnar: “Kơbĭ bu 'maih klĕp che 'nao tam mă tơtrŭt tơ che ao so. Tơ̆ng bu klĕp, ưh kơ jor che 'nao gô hek che ao so să hloh kơ 'noh dơ̆ng.

English: And no one puts new wine into old wineskins; or else the new wine bursts the wineskins, the wine is spilled, and the wineskins are ruined. But new wine must be put into new wineskins.”
Bahnar: Kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n kơbĭ bu 'maih tring sik 'nao 'băt kơtang mong tơ kơdŭng akar so. Tơ̆ng bu tring, sik 'nao 'băt kơtang tơ kơdŭng akar so pă jor gô pơchah. Đak sik gô lĕch hiong. Tơ̆ng bu wă tring, sư athei tring mong sik 'nao tơ kơdŭng akar 'nao, yua kơ kơdŭng akar 'nao 'noh kơjăp.”

English: Now it happened that He went through the grainfields on the Sabbath; and as they went His disciples began to pluck the heads of grain.
Bahnar: Lăm minh năr pơdơh Sa'bat ei, Yêsu păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư drong mơ̆t tơ mir na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư broch găr 'ba kăp sa ngôi.

English: And the Pharisees said to Him, “Look, why do they do what is not lawful on the Sabbath?”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai Pharisi khan kơ Yêsu: “Ih lăng. Kơlih kơ kiơ lu sư pơm ưh kơ trŏ lăm năr pơdơh, năr pơdơh khan jang?”

English: But He said to them, “Have you never read what David did when he was in need and hungry, he and those with him
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm tam biơh đŏk lăng lăm hla bơar tơdrong pơtao Đawit ôh hă? Sơ̆ sư kư̆m pơm ưh kơ trŏ kơ tơdrong juăt mơ̆n, sư păng lu bôl sư pơngot ưh kơ đei tơmam sa.

English: how he went into the house of God in the days of Abiathar the high priest, and ate the showbread, which is not lawful to eat except for the priests, and also gave some to those who were with him?”
Bahnar: Lu sư mơ̆t lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, Abiatha oei pơm 'bok soi tơm sơ̆. Đawit sư ưh kơ pơm 'bok soi ôh, mă-lei sư kư̆m gơh iŏk sa 'bĕng đe pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n. 'Bĕng đe pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pôm lu 'bok soi đĕch gơh sa; mă-lei 'bok Đawit sư iŏk asong kơ lu bôl sư sa mơ̆n.”

English: And He said to them, “The Sabbath was made for man, and not man for the Sabbath.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai Pharisi: “'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing năr pơdơh Sa'bat wă pơyua kon bơngai đei năr pơdơh, ưh kơ sĭ Sư pơjing năr Sa'bat wă kơ kon bơngai iŏk tơdrong gleh ôh.

English: Therefore the Son of Man is also Lord of the Sabbath.”
Bahnar: Inh Kon Bơngai, Inh Yŏng tơm kơ năr pơdơh Sa'bat.”

English: And He entered the synagogue again, and a man was there who had a withered hand.
Bahnar: Yêsu mơ̆t dơ̆ng tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei. Đei minh 'nu bơngai ti kue minh pah oei lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei ei.

English: So they watched Him closely, whether He would heal him on the Sabbath, so that they might accuse Him.
Bahnar: Na đe răp lăng Yêsu hăm ming pơklaih sư dah ưh yua kơ năr noh năr pơdơh Sa'bat. Dah Sư pơklaih bơngai ti kue noh, lei đe wă jô̆ kơ Sư bơngai yoch, yua kơ lu sư khan lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat ưh kơ gơh jang păng ưh kơ gơh pơklaih bơngai jĭ jăn ôh.

English: And He said to the man who had the withered hand, “Step forward.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu krao bơngai ti kue ei khan: “Năm tơ âu bĕ, dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp đe tơpôl.”

English: Then He said to them, “Is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good or to do evil, to save life or to kill?” But they kept silent.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai ei thoi âu: “Lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n athei pơm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng dah tơdrong kơnê̆, tơgŭm mơnat kon bơngai dah pơlôch bơngai?” Mă-lei lu đe ei thĕng, ưh kơ đei bu pơma tơwih kơ Sư.

English: And when He had looked around at them with anger, being grieved by the hardness of their hearts, He said to the man, “Stretch out your hand.” And he stretched it out, and his hand was restored as whole as the other.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu hue lăng đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư, Sư hil kơ lu sư. Sư sơ'ngon yua kơ lu sư arăng kơ̆l. Na Sư khan kơ bơngai ti kue: “Chro ti ih bĕ.” Bơngai ti kue ei chro ti sư, na klaih 'lơ̆ng hloi.

English: Then the Pharisees went out and immediately plotted with the Herodians against Him, how they might destroy Him.
Bahnar: Lu đe ei khŭl Pharisi, lu sư lĕch hloi đơ̆ng hnam akŭm ei năm pơđâu tơ lu khŭl đe pơtao Hêrôt chă tơdrong wă kơ gơh rôp pơlôch Yêsu.

English: But Jesus withdrew with His disciples to the sea. And a great multitude from Galilee followed Him, and from Judea
Bahnar: Yêsu păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư năm tơ đak dơsĭ. Đei lơ bơngai tơpă kiơ̆ Sư tơ ei mơ̆n yua kơ đe kơtơ̆ng ang tôm tơdrong Yêsu pơm, na đe năm tơ Sư. Lu bơngai năm tơ Sư ei mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh Galilê, mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh Juđê, mơ'nah đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem, mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh Idumia, mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh pah to krong Jôrđăn; kư̆m đei mơ'nah đơ̆ng tơring Tirơ păng đơ̆ng tơring Siđôn.

English: and Jerusalem and Idumea and beyond the Jordan; and those from Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, when they heard how many things He was doing, came to Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư năm tơ đak dơsĭ. Đei lơ bơngai tơpă kiơ̆ Sư tơ ei mơ̆n yua kơ đe kơtơ̆ng ang tôm tơdrong Yêsu pơm, na đe năm tơ Sư. Lu bơngai năm tơ Sư ei mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh Galilê, mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh Juđê, mơ'nah đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem, mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh Idumia, mơ'nah đơ̆ng dêh pah to krong Jôrđăn; kư̆m đei mơ'nah đơ̆ng tơring Tirơ păng đơ̆ng tơring Siđôn.

English: So He told His disciples that a small boat should be kept ready for Him because of the multitude, lest they should crush Him.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu athei lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư 'măn kơ Sư thŏng-nan jê̆ jih đak wă kơ Sư hao kơpal thŏng-nan ei; dah Sư dơ̆ng tơ kông hli kơ đe hmĕt hmot Sư.

English: For He healed many, so that as many as had afflictions pressed about Him to touch Him.
Bahnar: Yua kơ Sư ming pơklaih lơ bơngai jĭ boih, na lu bơngai jĭ jăn tơbeng dih băl tơkan năm pel Yêsu.

English: And the unclean spirits, whenever they saw Him, fell down before Him and cried out, saying, “You are the Son of God.”
Bahnar: Tơ ei kư̆m đei lu bơngai yang mơ̆t sư 'bôh Yêsu, sư 'nap truh tơ teh 'bơ̆t anăp Yêsu păng pơma re 'bơ̆r khan: “Ih boih Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.”

English: But He sternly warned them that they should not make Him known.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khă sư: “'Nĕ tơbăt anăn Inh kơ đe.”

English: And He went up on the mountain and called to Him those He Himself wanted. And they came to Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu tŏk tơ groi kông na Sư rơih chă lu bơngai mă Sư wă kiơ̆ Sư. Na lu bơngai mă Sư rơih chă ei lĕch kơdih kơdih đơ̆ng bơngai tơpôl năm tơ Sư.

English: Then He appointed twelve, that they might be with Him and that He might send them out to preach
Bahnar: Sư rơih mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai wă oei hơdai Sư păng wă kơ Sư chă wơh năm bơtho

English: and to have power to heal sicknesses and to cast out demons
Bahnar: păng gơh pơpuh tơlĕch dôm lu yang kơnê̆ mă mơ̆t oei tơ lăm akâu đe.

English: Simon, to whom He gave the name Peter
Bahnar: Na âu jô̆ tôm lu anăn mơjĭt-'bar 'nu lu sư: Simôn mă Yêsu anăn Pêtrôs

English: James the son of Zebedee and John the brother of James, to whom He gave the name Boanerges, that is, “Sons of Thunder”
Bahnar: Yakơ hăm oh sư Yôhan; 'bă bre sư Sêbêđê. Sư anăn dơ̆ng bre 'bar 'nu Bôanet wă khan bre sư dang glaih yua kơ bre sư pơma 'bơ̆r re.

English: Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, Simon the Cananite
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lu đe Andrê, Philip, 'Barthôlêmi, Mathiơ, Thôm, Yakơ kon Alphê, Thađê, Simôn mă kiơ̆ khŭl đe Sêlôt sơ̆

English: and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed Him. And they went into a house.
Bahnar: Juđa Ikariôt bơngai mă plơ̆ plĕch Sư. Klaih kơ noh na Yêsu wih tơ hnam.

English: Then the multitude came together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.
Bahnar: Lơ bơngai năm akŭm dơ̆ng tơ đe Yêsu, na lu sư jing ưh kơ gơh sŏng sa.

English: But when His own people heard about this, they went out to lay hold of Him, for they said, “He is out of His mind.”
Bahnar: Hnam dơnŏ Yêsu kơtơ̆ng ang thoi noh, na lu sư năm wă iŏk Yêsu wă anhăk wih tơ hnam, kơlih kơ đe khan Yêsu Sư wă wơnh.

English: And the scribes who came down from Jerusalem said, “He has Beelzebub,” and, “By the ruler of the demons He casts out demons.”
Bahnar: Lu 'bok thây bơtho khôi juăt bơngai Juđê mă jur đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem lu sư khan: “Yŏng pơgơ̆r lu yang kơnê̆, măt sư Belsêbul, mơ̆t lăm akâu Yêsu boih.” Lu mơ'nah dơ̆ng khan: “Yŏng pơgơ̆r lu yang kơnê̆ tơgŭm Sư na Sư gơh pơpuh lu yang kơnê̆ nai.”

English: So He called them to Himself and said to them in parables: “How can Satan cast out Satan?
Bahnar: Na Yêsu krao lu bơngai mă pơma kơ Sư thoi noh, na Sư pơma pơtih gia kơ lu sư: “Lơliơ yŏng pơgơ̆r yang kơnê̆ mă gơh pơpuh tơduă yang kơnê̆?

English: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
Bahnar: Dah minh pôm teh đak tơblah dih băl, teh đak noh gô pơchah hiong

English: And if a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
Bahnar: dah minh pôm hnam dơnŏ tơblah dih băl tơduă hnam dơnŏ, hnam dơnŏ noh kư̆m pơchah hiong mơ̆n.

English: And if Satan has risen up against himself, and is divided, he cannot stand, but has an end.
Bahnar: Thoi noh dah yŏng pơgơ̆r yang kơnê̆ tơblah tơduă yang kơnê̆, lei sư gô hiong tôch.

English: No one can enter a strong man’s house and plunder his goods, unless he first binds the strong man. And then he will plunder his house.
Bahnar: “Thoi âu dơ̆ng: Ưh kơ đei bu gơh mơ̆t blah iŏk tơmam bơngai pran dah ưh kơ chô̆ jơ̆ng ti sư hơdrol; đe chô̆ jơ̆ng ti sư hơdrol 'mơ̆i na gơh mơ̆t blah iŏk tơmam sư lăm hnam. Na Inh tơblah hăm yang kơnê̆ kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: “Assuredly, I say to you, all sins will be forgiven the sons of men, and whatever blasphemies they may utter
Bahnar: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, mă dôm tơdrong yoch, mă dôm 'măng pơjăm 'Bok Kei-Dei, dah bơ̆n apinh Sư 'nĕ jô̆ yo, 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m huay kơ jô̆ yo ôh, Sư oei tơgŭm pơklaih đĕch.

English: but he who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is subject to eternal condemnation”
Bahnar: Mă-lei dah bu pơjăm Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư, 'Bok Kei-Dei Sư ưh kơ layơ wă pơklaih bơngai mă pơjăm Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư 'noh, mă-lei bơngai noh tơdrong yoch oei oei khŏm khŏm ưh kơ đei layơ tôch.”

English: because they said, “He has an unclean spirit.”
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma thoi noh yua kơ lu đe noh pơjăm Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng mă oei lăm akâu Sư khan yang kơnê̆.

English: Then His brothers and His mother came, and standing outside they sent to Him, calling Him.
Bahnar: Oh Yêsu hăm mĕ Sư năm tơ Sư. Lu sư dơ̆ng tơ 'ngoaih hnam, na wơh đe năm krao Yêsu.

English: And a multitude was sitting around Him; and they said to Him, “Look, Your mother and Your brothers are outside seeking You.”
Bahnar: Đei lơ bơngai oei tăp dăr kơ Yêsu, na đe khan kơ Sư: “Mĕ Ih hăm oh Ih dơ̆ng tơ 'ngoaih hnam to, sư chă Ih.”

English: But He answered them, saying, “Who is My mother, or My brothers?”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Bu mĕ Inh hăm oh Inh ei?”

English: And He looked around in a circle at those who sat about Him, and said, “Here are My mother and My brothers!
Bahnar: Yêsu hue lăng lu bơngai mă oei tăp dăr kơ Sư ei păng khan: “Lu bơngai kiơ̆ âu dang mĕ Inh păng oh Inh mơ̆n.

English: And again He began to teach by the sea. And a great multitude was gathered to Him, so that He got into a boat and sat in it on the sea; and the whole multitude was on the land facing the sea.
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho tơ jih đak dơsĭ Galilê dơ̆ng. Đei lơ bơngai tơpă akŭm tăp dăr kơ Sư na Sư tŏk oei kơpal thŏng-nan tơ đak. Lu bơngai lơ ei oei tơ jih đak.

English: Then He taught them many things by parables, and said to them in His teaching
Bahnar: Sư bơtho lơ tơdrong hăm nơ̆r pơtih gia. Sư bơtho khan thoi âu

English: “Listen! Behold, a sower went out to sow.
Bahnar: “Mơ̆ng bĕ bre. Đei minh 'nu bơngai năm rei adrĕch 'ba.

English: And it happened, as he sowed, that some seed fell by the wayside; and the birds of the air came and devoured it.
Bahnar: Lăp sư rei, đei găr mơ'nah huŏng tơ trong, na sem jur choh sa.

English: Some fell on stony ground, where it did not have much earth; and immediately it sprang up because it had no depth of earth.
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei mơ'nah huŏng kơpal tơmo trêl ưh kơ gan đei teh lơ. Ưh kơ đunh sư kư̆m chăt mơ̆n mă teh ưh kơ mah.

English: But when the sun was up it was scorched, and because it had no root it withered away.
Bahnar: Lăp 'năr tŏ boih sư jô jing lôch hloi yua kơ rơh sư chăt ưh kơ jrŭ.

English: And some seed fell among thorns; and the thorns grew up and choked it, and it yielded no crop.
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei mơ'nah huŏng tơ 'nhĕt jơla. Lăp 'nhĕt jơla kơjung boih jơla krênh 'ba noh, sư ưh kơ đei plei ôh.

English: But other seed fell on good ground and yielded a crop that sprang up, increased and produced: some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some a hundred.”
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei mơ'nah huŏng tơ teh 'lơ̆ng, na đei plei. Sư chăt kơjung 'lơ̆ng, klaih kơ noh đei plei trem, mơ'nah pêng-jĭt, mơ'nah tơdrâu-jĭt, mơ'nah minh-hrĕng.”

English: And He said to them, “He who has ears to hear, let him hear!”
Bahnar: Na Sư khan: “Bu đei đon athei tơchĕng kơdih bĕ.”

English: But when He was alone, those around Him with the twelve asked Him about the parable.
Bahnar: Lăp lu đe nai wih boih, na lu mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư păng lu bơngai nai tam mă wih, oei tăp dăr kơ Yêsu, na lu sư jet tơdrong pơtih gia hei.

English: And He said to them, “To you it has been given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God; but to those who are outside, all things come in parables
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu iĕm băt gah tơdrong Sư wă pơgơ̆r kon bơngai thoi yơ. Mă-lei Inh bơtho lu bơngai nai tôm tơdrong păng nơ̆r pơjuang ngăl

English: so that ‘Seeing they may see and not perceive, And hearing they may hear and not understand; Lest they should turn, And their sins be forgiven them.’ ”
Bahnar: ‘Wă kơ sư lăng khŏm khŏm ră, mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh tơdrong kiơ; wă kơ sư mơ̆ng khŏm khŏm ră mă-lei ưh kơ hlôh. Dah sư hlôh kơnh sư gơh tơchĕng kơdih băt wih tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơklaih đĭ dôm tơdrong yoch sư.’ ”

English: And He said to them, “Do you not understand this parable? How then will you understand all the parables?
Bahnar: Na Sư khan dơ̆ng: “Iĕm ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong Inh pơtih gia 'noh hei hă? Tơ̆ng lei lơliơ iĕm gơh hlôh tôm tơdrong Inh pơtih gia nai?

English: The sower sows the word.
Bahnar: Bơngai mă rei adrĕch 'ba 'noh wă khan bơngai bơtho nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And these are the ones by the wayside where the word is sown. When they hear, Satan comes immediately and takes away the word that was sown in their hearts.
Bahnar: Lăp đe bơtho nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu bơngai mơ'nah thoi lĕ kơ găr 'ba đêl đe rei mơ'nah huŏng 'bơ̆t trong. Lu sư kơtơ̆ng ră nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, na yang Satan yŏng pơgơ̆r yang kơnê̆, sư tơgar iŏk nơ̆r đêl đe bơtho 'noh.

English: These likewise are the ones sown on stony ground who, when they hear the word, immediately receive it with gladness
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă thoi lĕ găr 'ba huŏng tơ teh tơmo kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n. Lu sư kơtơ̆ng đe bơtho nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu sư hưch hanh kư̆m iŏk ră nơ̆r noh mơ̆n.

English: and they have no root in themselves, and so endure only for a time. Afterward, when tribulation or persecution arises for the word’s sake, immediately they stumble.
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei ră tơnơm 'ba, mă-lei rơh sư chăt ưh kơ jrŭ, sư jing jô lôch hloi. 'Noh wă khan lu sư dang đei ră đon lui, mă-lei ưh kơ đunh, lu sư jing achăng lê̆ yua kơ đe areh kơ lu sư lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Now these are the ones sown among thorns; they are the ones who hear the word
Bahnar: Đei lu bơngai mơ'nah thoi lĕ kơ găr 'ba huŏng 'bơ̆t 'nhĕt jơla. Lu sư kơtơ̆ng đe bơtho nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: and the cares of this world, the deceitfulness of riches, and the desires for other things entering in choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư wă tơchĕng tơdrong arih sư kăl hloh. Sư wă kơ mơdrŏng; păng 'nhĕng lơ tơdrong âu tơdrong to. Thoi noh na tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ gơh wơ̆ păng ưh kơ đei plei.

English: But these are the ones sown on good ground, those who hear the word, accept it, and bear fruit: some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some a hundred.”
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai mă thoi lĕ kơ găr 'ba huŏng 'bơ̆t teh 'lơ̆ng, lu bơngai 'noh boih kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, na iŏk hloi kơdih păng kiơ̆ hloi kơjăp, na đei plei, mơ'nah pêng-jĭt, mơ'nah tơdrâu-jĭt, mơ'nah đei plei trem truh tơ minh-hrĕng.”

English: Also He said to them, “Is a lamp brought to be put under a basket or under a bed? Is it not to be set on a lampstand?
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho dơ̆ng kơ lu đe noh, Sư khan: “Bơ̆n tơ̆k ŭnh kơđeng wă kơ hơdah; bơ̆n ưh kơ iŏk reo klơ̆p lê̆, dah 'măn ala rimrôm giơng wă kơ măng mu ôh. Bơ̆n iŏk ŭnh kơđeng noh tơ'băk tơ jrăng.

English: For there is nothing hidden which will not be revealed, nor has anything been kept secret but that it should come to light.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tôm tơdrong Inh bơtho pơjuang kơ iĕm dang ei, iĕm gô hlôh nhen.

English: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei đon, mơ̆ng mă nhên bĕ.”

English: Then He said to them, “Take heed what you hear. With the same measure you use, it will be measured to you; and to you who hear, more will be given.
Bahnar: Sư khan dơ̆ng kơ lu đe noh: “Mơ̆ng mă nhên hŏ. Iĕm mơ̆ng dang yơ, iĕm gô hlôh dang noh păng 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơthim ăn kơ iĕm hlôh hloh kơ noh dơ̆ng.

English: For whoever has, to him more will be given; but whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu hlôh, 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơthim ăn kơ sư hlôh hloh kơ noh dơ̆ng tơpă. Bơngai bu ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng, bơngai 'noh rai hiong dôm tơdrong sư hlôh.”

English: And He said, “The kingdom of God is as if a man should scatter seed on the ground
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng: “'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r thoi âu: Pơtih gia đei bơngai rei adrĕch 'ba tơ mir.

English: and should sleep by night and rise by day, and the seed should sprout and grow, he himself does not know how.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh tơ'ngla sư kơmăng tep kơ'năr iung, adrĕch 'ba 'noh chăt kơjung boih mă-lei tơ'ngla sư ưh kơ pơm ăn kơ sư arih ôh.

English: For the earth yields crops by itself: first the blade, then the head, after that the full grain in the head.
Bahnar: Sư gơh arih kơdih đơ̆ng teh. Blŭng-a sư sơđah chăt hla. Klaih kơ noh sư hnông; klaih kơ hnông, sư huăt đei plei.

English: But when the grain ripens, immediately he puts in the sickle, because the harvest has come.”
Bahnar: Lăp 'ba đum boih, na tơ'ngla sư wơh đe năm kĕch, yua kơ trŏ bơyan 'ba đum boih.”

English: Then He said, “To what shall we liken the kingdom of God? Or with what parable shall we picture it?
Bahnar: Yêsu bơtho dơ̆ng kơ lu đe noh: “'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r thoi yơ, bơ̆n chă tơdrong kiơ wă pơtih gia kơ tơdrong noh?

English: It is like a mustard seed which, when it is sown on the ground, is smaller than all the seeds on earth
Bahnar: Lu bơngai 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r thoi lĕ găr sơ'bei, găr noh iĕ hloh kơ đĭ-đăng găr nai.

English: but when it is sown, it grows up and becomes greater than all herbs, and shoots out large branches, so that the birds of the air may nest under its shade.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăp đe rei boih sư chăt kơjung hloh kơ đĭ-đăng hla 'nhot nai. Sư kư̆m đei dơng na sem kư̆m mah gơh kôp, gơh pơm tơpu tơ hla sư.”

English: And with many such parables He spoke the word to them as they were able to hear it.
Bahnar: Yêsu đei lơ tơdrong pơtih gia nai păng Sư oei bơtho đe nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, gô mơ̆ng kơ đe hlôh.

English: But without a parable He did not speak to them. And when they were alone, He explained all things to His disciples.
Bahnar: Sư bơtho đe, Sư bơtho pơtih gia ngăl, mă-lei dah Sư oei păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư, Sư bơtho tơblang tôm tơdrong.

English: On the same day, when evening had come, He said to them, “Let us cross over to the other side.”
Bahnar: Lăp 'năr wă mơ̆t kơsơ̆ ei, Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “Bĕ bơ̆n tŏk pah to đak.”

English: Now when they had left the multitude, they took Him along in the boat as He was. And other little boats were also with Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu oei tơ kơpal thŏng-nan đĕch đơ̆ng hei boih. Na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư tơklah đơ̆ng lu bơngai tơpôl lơ, anhăk Yêsu kiơ̆ lu sư tŏk pah to đak. Păng đei 'bar pêng tŏ thŏng-nan nai năm kiơ̆ lu sư mơ̆n.

English: And a great windstorm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, so that it was already filling.
Bahnar: Lu sư oei wơ̆r thŏng-nan yak kơpal đak đei hloi kial hơbŭt tih tơpă. Đak poh-yă tih tơprah mơ̆t tơ lăm thŏng-nan lu sư, pă 'biơ̆ wă jê̆ 'bĕnh.

English: But He was in the stern, asleep on a pillow. And they awoke Him and said to Him, “Teacher, do You not care that we are perishing?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu oei tep akơn tơ rŏng thŏng-nan. Na lu đe ei râu Yêsu păng khan: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, Ih ưh kơ tơchĕng hli kơ bơ̆n lôch hă?”

English: Then He arose and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, “Peace, be still!” And the wind ceased and there was a great calm.
Bahnar: Na Sư iung khă hloi kial păng khan kơ đak dơsĭ: “Thĕng bĕ, păt bĕ.” Kial thĕng hloi, đak poh-yă kư̆m pă adrŏ adrĕnh.

English: But He said to them, “Why are you so fearful? How is it that you have no faith?”
Bahnar: Na Sư khan kơ lu đe ei: “Yua kơ kiơ iĕm hli? Iĕm tam băt gơnang kơ Inh hă?”

English: And they feared exceedingly, and said to one another, “Who can this be, that even the wind and the sea obey Him!”
Bahnar: Lu đe ei hli dêh na lu sư apinh băl: “Bu âu kih, kial hơbŭt păng đak dơsĭ poh-yă dang noh mă kư̆m chu yom kơ Sư?”

English: Then they came to the other side of the sea, to the country of the Gadarenes.
Bahnar: Lu sư tŏk hloh pah to đak dơsĭ tơ tơring đe Gerasen.

English: And when He had come out of the boat, immediately there met Him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu jur đơ̆ng thŏng-nan đei minh 'nu bơngai yang mơ̆t pơm kơ sư wơnh lĕch đơ̆ng bơsat năm tơkan tơ Yêsu.

English: who had his dwelling among the tombs; and no one could bind him, not even with chains
Bahnar: Bơngai ei oei tơ bơsat ling-lang. Mă khan đe chô̆ sư păng tơlei glang mam ră sư hrĕch kơtĕch đĭ, kơbĭ bu gơh chô̆ sư.

English: because he had often been bound with shackles and chains. And the chains had been pulled apart by him, and the shackles broken in pieces; neither could anyone tame him.
Bahnar: Lơ 'măng boih đe chô̆ ră jơ̆ng ti sư păng tơlei glang mam, mă-lei sư hrĕch kơtĕch kơtoch đĭ tơlei glang mam noh. Sư kư̆m pơchah dơlŏng mam đêl đe dơlŏng jơ̆ng sư, kơbĭ bu pơ̆n chô̆ wei sư dơ̆ng.

English: And always, night and day, he was in the mountains and in the tombs, crying out and cutting himself with stones.
Bahnar: Mă kơmăng, mă kơ'năr, sư oei tơ bơsat, phŏ tơ kông, sư ling-lang tơkĕch păng iŏk tơmo tôn akâu sư kơdih.

English: When he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and worshiped Him.
Bahnar: Lăp sư tơmang 'bôh Yêsu oei ataih, na sư kơdâu tơkan 'nap hloi 'bơ̆t anăp Yêsu.

English: And he cried out with a loud voice and said, “What have I to do with You, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I implore You by God that You do not torment me.”
Bahnar: Yêsu athei yang kơnê̆ lĕch đơ̆ng akâu sư. Na yang kơnê̆ ei pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Ơ Yêsu, Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Ih wă pơm kiơ kơ inh? Inh apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm 'long sơlam kơ ba, na Ih 'nĕ kơ pơrăm inh.”

English: For He said to him, “Come out of the man, unclean spirit!”
Bahnar: Yêsu athei yang kơnê̆ lĕch đơ̆ng akâu sư. Na yang kơnê̆ ei pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Ơ Yêsu, Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Ih wă pơm kiơ kơ inh? Inh apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm 'long sơlam kơ ba, na Ih 'nĕ kơ pơrăm inh.”

English: Then He asked him, “What is your name?” And he answered, saying, “My name is Legion; for we are many.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu jet anăn sư: “Anăn ih bu?” Sư khan: “Anăn inh Tơpôl yua kơ nhôn lơ.”

English: Also he begged Him earnestly that He would not send them out of the country.
Bahnar: Sư apinh Yêsu 'bơ'bel khan: “'Nĕ pơpuh nhôn jăk đơ̆ng tơring âu.”

English: Now a large herd of swine was feeding there near the mountains.
Bahnar: Đei minh tơpôl nhŭng chă sa kiơ̆ groi ei.

English: So all the demons begged Him, saying, “Send us to the swine, that we may enter them.”
Bahnar: Na lu yang kơnê̆ apinh Yêsu khan: “Ih ăn kơ nhôn jăk mơ̆t tơ lu nhŭng to.”

English: And at once Jesus gave them permission. Then the unclean spirits went out and entered the swine (there were about two thousand); and the herd ran violently down the steep place into the sea, and drowned in the sea.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu ăn kơ lu sư. Na lu yang kơnê̆ ei lĕch hloi mơ̆t tơ tơpôl lu nhŭng oei chă sa kiơ̆ ei. Lu nhŭng ei dang 'bar-rơbâu kơdâu jur đơ̆ng kông groi ei huŏng hơtat tơ đak dơsĭ glơ̆k lôch đĭ minh tơpôl nhŭng ei.

English: So those who fed the swine fled, and they told it in the city and in the country. And they went out to see what it was that had happened.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai wei nhŭng 'bôh thoi noh na kơdâu chă roi kơ đe jơ̆p-jang lăm pơlei ei. Na lu kon pơlei pơla năm lăng tơdrong noh lơliơ.

English: Then they came to Jesus, and saw the one who had been demon-possessed and had the legion, sitting and clothed and in his right mind. And they were afraid.
Bahnar: Lu sư năm tơ Yêsu na 'bôh bơngai mă đêl yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t ei oei ngôi 'bơ̆t ei. Sư hrŭk hơbĕn ao thoi lĕ bơngai hmă boih, ưh pă wơnh dơ̆ng. Na lu sư khan: “Bơngai 'nâu boih yang kơnê̆ pơm kơ sư wơnh dêh ki.” Na lu sư hli kơ Yêsu.

English: And those who saw it told them how it happened to him who had been demon-possessed, and about the swine.
Bahnar: Lu đe mă đêl 'bôh Yêsu pơklaih bơngai wơnh 'noh păng tơdrong nhŭng 'noh hei, lu sư chă roi kơ đe tơdrong noh dơ̆ng.

English: Then they began to plead with Him to depart from their region.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na đe apinh Yêsu athei Sư jăk đơ̆ng tơring đe ei.

English: And when He got into the boat, he who had been demon-possessed begged Him that he might be with Him.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu tŏk thŏng-nan na bơngai mă 'nao klaih kơ wơnh ei apinh kiơ̆ oei păng Yêsu.

English: However, Jesus did not permit him, but said to him, “Go home to your friends, and tell them what great things the Lord has done for you, and how He has had compassion on you.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu ưh kơ ăn, Sư khan kơ bơngai ei khan: “Ih wih brŏk tơ 'nhŏng oh ih păng ih roi kơ lu sư tơdrong tih-tin ih dang yơ păng 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm mơnat kơ ih dang yơ, na Sư mah pơklaih ih dang noh.”

English: And he departed and began to proclaim in Decapolis all that Jesus had done for him; and all marveled.
Bahnar: Na sư wih tơ hnam chă roi kơ đe lăm tơring Đêkapôlis tôm tơdrong Yêsu pơklaih ăn kơ sư na đĭ-đăng bơngai sơleng kơ đon.

English: Now when Jesus had crossed over again by boat to the other side, a great multitude gathered to Him; and He was by the sea.
Bahnar: Yêsu tŏk thŏng-nan brŏk tơ anih pah âu dơ̆ng, tơ ei đei lơ bơngai akŭm tăp dăr kơ Sư. Yêsu oei tơ jih đak dơsĭ.

English: And behold, one of the rulers of the synagogue came, Jairus by name. And when he saw Him, he fell at His feet
Bahnar: Tơ ei đei minh 'nu kră wei-lăng hnam akŭm đe Juđê lăm pơlei kiơ̆ ei, sư năm tơ Yêsu. Anăn sư Jairut. Lăp sư truh tơ Yêsu 'bok ei 'nap 'bơ̆t anăp Sư.

English: and begged Him earnestly, saying, “My little daughter lies at the point of death. Come and lay Your hands on her, that she may be healed, and she will live.”
Bahnar: Sư apinh lung Yêsu khan: “Kon adruh inh wă jê̆ lôch. Apinh Ih năm chro ti pel akâu sư wă kơ sư klaih, huay kơ lôch.”

English: So Jesus went with him, and a great multitude followed Him and thronged Him.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu năm kiơ̆ sư. Kư̆m đei lơ bơngai yak hơdai Yêsu bĭt hmĕt hmot Sư.

English: Now a certain woman had a flow of blood for twelve years
Bahnar: Lăm ei đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn sư jĭ tuh pham ling-lang đei mơjĭt-'bar sơnăm boih.

English: and had suffered many things from many physicians. She had spent all that she had and was no better, but rather grew worse.
Bahnar: Đei lơ 'bok pơgang ming ră, sư pơhuach đĭ jên mŭk tơmam sư ră, mă-lei jĭ sư 'nhŏ kơ klaih 'biơ̆, rai đunh rai dêh.

English: When she heard about Jesus, she came behind Him in the crowd and touched His garment.
Bahnar: Sư kơtơ̆ng ang Yêsu gơh pơklaih, na sư hơdai năm păng đe kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng Yêsu.

English: For she said, “If only I may touch His clothes, I shall be made well.”
Bahnar: Na duch ei tơchĕng kơdih khan: “Dah inh pel pôm ao Sư đĕch inh klaih mơ̆n.”

English: Immediately the fountain of her blood was dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of the affliction.
Bahnar: Na duch ei năm chur pel pôm ao Sư đĕch, kơtă ei sư huay pă tuh pham dơ̆ng. Na duch ei mơn lăm akâu sư klaih kơ jĭ boih.

English: And Jesus, immediately knowing in Himself that power had gone out of Him, turned around in the crowd and said, “Who touched My clothes?”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Yêsu băt lăm akâu Sư kơdih đei mơsêh Sư lĕch đơ̆ng akâu Sư. Na Sư hue tơ tŏk-bŏk tơpôl lơ păng khan: “Bu pel ao Inh?”

English: But His disciples said to Him, “You see the multitude thronging You, and You say, ‘Who touched Me?’ ”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan: “Kơbĭ bu đei pel. Ih lăng lu bơngai tơpôl âu hmĕt hmot Ih, mă Ih khan: ‘Bu pel ao Inh?’ ”

English: And He looked around to see her who had done this thing.
Bahnar: Na Sư hue lăng tăp dăr wă kơ băt bơngai ayơ pơm tơdrong 'noh hei.

English: But the woman, fearing and trembling, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell down before Him and told Him the whole truth.
Bahnar: Na duch mă pel ao Sư hei, akâu sư tơtey hli yua kơ sư băt tơdrong 'noh hei pơm kơ sư klaih boih, na sư năm 'nap tơ Yêsu păng roi đĭ tơdrong 'noh hei kơ Sư.

English: And He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be healed of your affliction.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Ơ duch, kơlih kơ ih lui na ih klaih, na dang ei brŏk kơ ih mă 'lơ̆ng bĕ. Ih klaih đĭ boih, ưh pă đei jĭ dơ̆ng.”

English: While He was still speaking, some came from the ruler of the synagogue’s house who said, “Your daughter is dead. Why trouble the Teacher any further?”
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei pơma, blư 'bôh 'bar pêng 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng hnam 'bok Jairut năm giong khan kơ sư: “Kon adruh ih lôch boih, ih oei pơhrat kiơ kơ 'Bok Thây?”

English: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, He said to the ruler of the synagogue, “Do not be afraid; only believe.”
Bahnar: Yêsu kơtơ̆ng đe pơtruh kơ 'bok Jairut thoi noh, Sư pơhơi. Na Sư khan kơ 'bok Jairut bơngai mă wei-lăng hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei ei khan: “Ih 'nĕ kơ hli, ih kư̆ kơ lui đĕch.”

English: And He permitted no one to follow Him except Peter, James, and John the brother of James.
Bahnar: Yêsu ưh kơ ăn đe kiơ̆ Sư, Sư ăn lu bơngai âu đĕch kiơ̆ Sư: Pêtrôs, Yakơ păng Yôhan mă oh Yakơ.

English: Then He came to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and saw a tumult and those who wept and wailed loudly.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư truh tơ hnam 'bok mă wei hnam akŭm ei, Yêsu 'bôh đe lơ tơpă tơjrông tơjrang mang oei nhơ̆m hmoi.

English: When He came in, He said to them, “Why make this commotion and weep? The child is not dead, but sleeping.”
Bahnar: Yêsu mơ̆t tơ lăm hnam ei khan kơ đe: “Iĕm mah nhơ̆m hmoi ơh kơ kiơ mah tơjrông tơjrang mang? Bơngai âu ưh kơ lôch ôh, sư tep đĕch.”

English: And they ridiculed Him. But when He had put them all outside, He took the father and the mother of the child, and those who were with Him, and entered where the child was lying.
Bahnar: Na đe ei hiĕk kơ Sư. Sư pơpuh lu bơngai oei lăm ei lĕch đĭ tơ 'ngoaih na anhăk mĕ 'bă adruh mă lôch noh păng pêng 'nu bơngai mă kiơ̆ Sư hei, mơ̆t tơ anih đe tơ'bĭch adruh mă lôch noh.

English: Then He took the child by the hand, and said to her, “Talitha, cumi,” which is translated, “Little girl, I say to you, arise.”
Bahnar: Yêsu rôp ti sư păng khan kơ sư hăm nơ̆r Juđê: “Talitha kumi,” wă khan: “Ơ mŏ adruh iĕ, Inh râu e, iung bĕ.”

English: Immediately the girl arose and walked, for she was twelve years of age. And they were overcome with great amazement.
Bahnar: Na adruh ei iung yak hloi. Adruh ei mơjĭt-'bar sơnăm. Lăp lu sư 'bôh thoi noh, lu sư sơleng kơ đon.

English: Then He went out from there and came to His own country, and His disciples followed Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu đơ̆ng noh brŏk tơ pơlei Sư kơdih, lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư kiơ̆ Sư mơ̆n.

English: And when the Sabbath had come, He began to teach in the synagogue. And many hearing Him were astonished, saying, “Where did this Man get these things? And what wisdom is this which is given to Him, that such mighty works are performed by His hands!
Bahnar: Lăm năr pơdơh Sa'bat Sư bơtho đe tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei. Đei lơ bơngai năm mơ̆ng. Lu sư mơ̆ng hlĭch kơ đon păng khan: “Sư gơh dôm tơdrong âu đơ̆ng yơ kih? Lơliơ Sư băt tôm dôm tơdrong âu păng Sư gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh?

English: Is this not the carpenter, the Son of Mary, and brother of James, Joses, Judas, and Simon? And are not His sisters here with us?” So they were offended at Him.
Bahnar: Bơngai âu Sư jang ot 'long đĕch lah. Sư kon Mari, 'nhŏng đe Yakơ, Jôsê, Jut, Simôn. Lu oh Sư drŏ-kăn oei tơ âu mơ̆n. Na lơliơ Sư gơh pơm dôm tơdrong noh?” Lu đe ei klai kơ Sư hơgei na jing kuă lui kơ Sư.

English: But Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor except in his own country, among his own relatives, and in his own house.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu đe ei: “Lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆, mưh tơ pơlei đe, đei lơ bơngai lăp đon 'maih mơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r sư bơtho dêh. Mă-lei lu bơngai oei pôm pơlei hăm lu sư, kơtum lu sư, hnam dơnŏ lu sư, ưh kơ 'maih wă mơ̆ng tơdrong sư bơtho ôh. Na truh tơ Inh dang ei kư̆m lei-lăi.”

English: Now He could do no mighty work there, except that He laid His hands on a few sick people and healed them.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ thoi noh na Yêsu ưh kơ wă pơm tơdrong mơsêh tơ pơlei Sư. Sư pôm chro ti chă pơklaih 'bar pêng 'nu bơngai jĭ đĕch.

English: And He marveled because of their unbelief. Then He went about the villages in a circuit, teaching.
Bahnar: Yêsu lăng hlĭch yua kơ đe ưh kơ wă lui kơ Sư. Na Sư năm chă bơtho tơ lu pơlei jơjê̆ kiơ̆ pơlei Sư ei.

English: And He called the twelve to Himself, and began to send them out two by two, and gave them power over unclean spirits.
Bahnar: Yêsu krao mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư năm tơ Sư; Sư athei năm chă bơtho đe 'bơ'bar 'nu. Sư ăn kơ lu sư gơh pơpuh tơlĕch yang kơnê̆ đơ̆ng akâu bơngai.

English: He commanded them to take nothing for the journey except a staff—no bag, no bread, no copper in their money belts
Bahnar: Na Sư athei lu sư năm 'nĕ kơ anhăk tơmam sa, 'nĕ kơ anhăk kơdŭng tah tơmam, 'nĕ kơ chĕp ba jên. Sư ăn chĕp tŏ 'long jra đĕch păng trô̆ chơkhŏ, hrŭk ao minh blah đĕch.

English: but to wear sandals, and not to put on two tunics.
Bahnar: Na Sư athei lu sư năm 'nĕ kơ anhăk tơmam sa, 'nĕ kơ anhăk kơdŭng tah tơmam, 'nĕ kơ chĕp ba jên. Sư ăn chĕp tŏ 'long jra đĕch păng trô̆ chơkhŏ, hrŭk ao minh blah đĕch.

English: Also He said to them, “In whatever place you enter a house, stay there till you depart from that place.
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ lu đe ei thoi âu: “Dah iĕm mơ̆t oei tơ hnam ayơ, iĕm oei hloi tơ hnam 'noh đĕch truh tơ năr iĕm wă năm tơ pơlei nai.

English: And whoever will not receive you nor hear you, when you depart from there, shake off the dust under your feet as a testimony against them. Assuredly, I say to you, it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city!”
Bahnar: Dah anih tơ yơ yơ ưh kơ sơng iŏk iĕm păng ưh kơ mơ̆ng nơ̆r iĕm bơtho, thoi noh na lăp iĕm brŏk đơ̆ng pơlei noh iĕm sơpuih 'bruih tơ jơ̆ng iĕm tơbăt kơ lu sư 'Bok Kei-Dei wă phak lu sư ning-mônh.”

English: So they went out and preached that people should repent.
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na lu sư năm bơtho athei đe tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch.

English: And they cast out many demons, and anointed with oil many who were sick, and healed them.
Bahnar: Păng lu sư pơpuh lơ yang kơnê̆ lĕch đơ̆ng akâu đe hăm pik kơ lu bơngai jĭ jăn đak pơgang. Na 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu bơngai jĭ jăn noh klaih.

English: Now King Herod heard of Him, for His name had become well known. And he said, “John the Baptist is risen from the dead, and therefore these powers are at work in him.”
Bahnar: Pơtao Hêrôt kơtơ̆ng ang tơdrong Yêsu, yua kơ đe ư-ang anăn Yêsu. Na lu mơ'nah khan Yôhan bơngai mă pơm 'batem kơ đe, sư lôch boih na dang ei sư iung arih dơ̆ng. Thoi noh na sư gơh pơm tôm tơdrong mơsêh âu.

English: Others said, “It is Elijah.” And others said, “It is the Prophet, or like one of the prophets.”
Bahnar: Lu mơ'nah dơ̆ng khan Yêsu Êli mă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆. Lu mơ'nah khan Sư minh 'nu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei nai sơ̆.

English: But when Herod heard, he said, “This is John, whom I beheaded; he has been raised from the dead!”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăp Hêrôt kơtơ̆ng tơdrong 'noh sư khan: “'Noh Yôhan tơpă, bơngai mă pơm 'batem kơ đe, 'bơ̆t mă inh pơlôch chơ̆ng ako sư sơ̆. Na dang ei sư iung arih đơ̆ng lôch.”

English: For Herod himself had sent and laid hold of John, and bound him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife; for he had married her.
Bahnar: Sơ̆ pơtao Hêrôt wơh đe năm rôp Yôhan tah lăm hnam phak tơpă, yua kơ minh 'nu duch anăn sư Hêrôđia wă kơ thoi noh. Duch Hêrôđia ei akăn oh Hêrôt, anăn sư Philip. Mă-lei 'nhŏng sư Hêrôt tơgar iŏk akăn oh sư.

English: Because John had said to Herod, “It is not lawful for you to have your brother’s wife.”
Bahnar: Na Yôhan khan kơ Hêrôt: “Ih tơgar iŏk akăn oh ih ưh kơ trŏ ôh.”

English: Therefore Herodias held it against him and wanted to kill him, but she could not
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ Yôhan khan thoi noh na duch Hêrôđia hil kơ Yôhan, athei đe pơlôch sư, mă-lei ưh kơ gơh

English: for Herod feared John, knowing that he was a just and holy man, and he protected him. And when he heard him, he did many things, and heard him gladly.
Bahnar: kơlih kơ pơtao Hêrôt hli kơ Yôhan. Hêrôt băt kơ Yôhan bơngai tơpăt păng bơngai đon 'lơ̆ng ling-lang. Thoi noh na sư ưh kơ ăn pơlôch, kơplah sư mơ̆ng Yôhan bơtho jơhngơ̆m sư wơ̆l wang ră mă-lei sư 'maih mơ̆ng mơ̆n.

English: Then an opportune day came when Herod on his birthday gave a feast for his nobles, the high officers, and the chief men of Galilee.
Bahnar: Lăm minh năr ei lăp kơ jơhngơ̆m duch Hêrôđia wă pơlôch Yôhan, năr ei sa et trŏ kơ năr Hêrôt tơpŭ. Na pơtao Hêrôt krao wơ̆n lu 'bok kuan tih, lu 'bok tih linh păng lu kră mơdrŏng.

English: And when Herodias’ daughter herself came in and danced, and pleased Herod and those who sat with him, the king said to the girl, “Ask me whatever you want, and I will give it to you.”
Bahnar: Na kon adruh duch Hêrôđia mơ̆t suang lăm hnam ei, pơtao Hêrôt păng lu 'bok mă năm hơpong kơ sư ei lăp đon tơpă. Na pơtao Hêrôt mah khan kơ adruh ei: “Apinh bĕ, ih wă kơ kiơ, inh kư̆m ăn.”

English: He also swore to her, “Whatever you ask me, I will give you, up to half my kingdom.”
Bahnar: 'Bok pơtao khan kơ sư tơpă: “Tơmam kiơ ih wă apinh, roi bĕ, inh gô ăn kơ ih tơpă. Dah inh hơlĕnh mă 'Bok Kei-Dei phak inh, mă ih apinh iŏk minh puăt teh đak inh, kư̆m bưh mơ̆n.”

English: So she went out and said to her mother, “What shall I ask?” And she said, “The head of John the Baptist!”
Bahnar: Na adruh ei lĕch năm jet mĕ sư: “Ơ mĕ, ih wă kơ inh apinh kiơ đơ̆ng 'bok pơtao?” Na mĕ sư khan: “E apinh chơ̆ng iŏk kơ̆l Yôhan bơngai mă pơm 'batem kơ đe.”

English: Immediately she came in with haste to the king and asked, saying, “I want you to give me at once the head of John the Baptist on a platter.”
Bahnar: Na adruh ei mơ̆t dơ̆ng tơ anih 'bok pơtao păng apinh sư khan: “Inh wă kơ ih chơ̆ng ăn kơ inh kơ̆l Yôhan 'măn 'bơ̆t pơnhan chhĕr dang ei hloi; bơngai mă pơm 'batem kơ đe, 'noh boih inh wă.”

English: And the king was exceedingly sorry; yet, because of the oaths and because of those who sat with him, he did not want to refuse her.
Bahnar: Lăp pơtao Hêrôt kơtơ̆ng thoi noh sư sơ'ngon dêh. Mă-lei đêl nơ̆r sư pơkă hơdrol mah hiap akâu sư kơdih 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai et sa, sư ưh pă gơh lê̆ yua kơ sư pơkă kơ adruh ei boih.

English: Immediately the king sent an executioner and commanded his head to be brought. And he went and beheaded him in prison
Bahnar: 'Bok pơtao wơh hloi minh 'nu linh năm chơ̆ng ako Yôhan. Na linh ei năm chơ̆ng hloi ako Yôhan lăm hnam phak

English: brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the girl; and the girl gave it to her mother.
Bahnar: chĕp ba kơ̆l Yôhan ei kơpal pơnhan chhĕr na ăn kơ adruh ei. Adruh ei iŏk năm ăn kơ mĕ sư.

English: When his disciples heard of it, they came and took away his corpse and laid it in a tomb.
Bahnar: Lăp lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yôhan kơtơ̆ng thoi noh, lu sư năm iŏk akâu sư tung 'bŭ tơ bơsat.

English: Then the apostles gathered to Jesus and told Him all things, both what they had done and what they had taught.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă Yêsu wơh năm chă bơtho đe ki, lu sư brŏk akŭm tơ Sư boih, na roi kơ Sư dôm tơdrong lu sư pơm păng bơtho.

English: And He said to them, “Come aside by yourselves to a deserted place and rest a while.” For there were many coming and going, and they did not even have time to eat.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Dang ei đĭ kơ bơ̆n năm kiơ̆ Inh tơ anih kueng kơdrô̆ wă kơ bơ̆n pơdơh 'biơ̆.” Sư khan thoi noh yua kơ lơ bơngai wih wơ̆t tơ lu sư 'nhŏ mă gơh sŏng sa.

English: So they departed to a deserted place in the boat by themselves.
Bahnar: Đang kơ pơma thoi noh lu sư tŏk thŏng-nan năm tơ anih kueng kơdrô̆.

English: But the multitudes saw them departing, and many knew Him and ran there on foot from all the cities. They arrived before them and came together to Him.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kư̆m đei lơ bơngai 'bôh Sư mơ̆n. Đe kơnăl kơ Sư boih na jơ̆p kơ tơring kiơ̆ ei năm kơdâu hơdrol gô tơ anih kueng 'noh.

English: And Jesus, when He came out, saw a great multitude and was moved with compassion for them, because they were like sheep not having a shepherd. So He began to teach them many things.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu jur đơ̆ng thŏng-nan, Sư 'bôh lơ bơngai tơpă gô Sư tơ anih 'noh. Na Sư mơnat dêh kơ lu bơngai tơpôl 'noh yua kơ lu bơngai tơpôl 'noh thoi lĕ triu ưh kơ đei bơngai wei-lăng. Na Sư bơtho lu đe ei lơ tơdrong.

English: When the day was now far spent, His disciples came to Him and said, “This is a deserted place, and already the hour is late.
Bahnar: Lăp hiưp kơsơ̆ boih lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan kơ Sư thoi âu: “Anih âu kueng chơngue dêh păng kơsơ̆ boih tăm.

English: Send them away, that they may go into the surrounding country and villages and buy themselves bread; for they have nothing to eat.”
Bahnar: Ih kuă kơ kiơ athei lu đe âu năm chă răt kơdih tơmam sa kiơ̆ pơlei jơjê̆ âu?”

English: But He answered and said to them, “You give them something to eat.” And they said to Him, “Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread and give them something to eat?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “Iĕm 'me lu sư wăi.” Na lu sư khan kơ Sư thoi âu: “Liơ nhôn kĕ răt truh 'bar-hrĕng hlak jên hu wă kơ gơh asong kơ lu sư tơmam sa?”

English: But He said to them, “How many loaves do you have? Go and see.” And when they found out they said, “Five, and two fish.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm đei hơdôm tŏ 'bĕng mi? Iĕm năm lăng.” Lu sư lăng 'bôh boih, na lu sư khan: “Lăp pơđăm tŏ 'bĕng mi păng 'bar hlak ka.”

English: Then He commanded them to make them all sit down in groups on the green grass.
Bahnar: Sư athei đĭ-đăng lu đe ei tơoei lơ jơ'bôt kơpal 'nhĕt adrih.

English: So they sat down in ranks, in hundreds and in fifties.
Bahnar: Lu đe ei tơoei minh jơ'bôt minh-hrĕng, minh jơ'bôt phŏ pơđăm-jĭt.

English: And when He had taken the five loaves and the two fish, He looked up to heaven, blessed and broke the loaves, and gave them to His disciples to set before them; and the two fish He divided among them all.
Bahnar: Sư iŏk pơđăm tŏ 'bĕng mi păng 'bar hlak ka ei, ngoi tơ plĕnh krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bă Sư 'Bok Kei-Dei, na phĕ hloi 'bĕng mi ei ăn kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư chă asong kơ lu bôl buăl. Sư kư̆m phĕ asong 'bar hlak ka ei wă kơ bôl buăl sa.

English: So they all ate and were filled.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu sư sa phĭ mah rơkah rơkai boih.

English: And they took up twelve baskets full of fragments and of the fish.
Bahnar: Na lu sư dônh tah 'bĕnh mơjĭt-'bar tŏ bai 'bĕng mi păng ka mă đơ̆ng đêl lu sư sa rơkah.

English: Now those who had eaten the loaves were about five thousand men.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă sŏng sa ei pơđăm-rơbâu 'nu jô̆ gah bơngai drŏ-nglo đĕch.

English: Immediately He made His disciples get into the boat and go before Him to the other side, to Bethsaida, while He sent the multitude away.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu athei lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư hao thŏng-nan rai tŏk gô pah to đak dơsĭ tơ Pơlei 'Betsaiđa păng Sư athei hloi lu bơngai tơpôl brŏk tơ anih hnam lu sư kơdih kơdih.

English: And when He had sent them away, He departed to the mountain to pray.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na Yêsu tơklah đơ̆ng lu đe ei tŏk tơ kông kơdrô̆ Sư wă krao khan kơ 'Bă Sư.

English: Now when evening came, the boat was in the middle of the sea; and He was alone on the land.
Bahnar: Lăp 'năr mơ̆t măng mơt boih thŏng-nan lu sư oei tŏk-bŏk đak dơsĭ. Gah Yêsu Sư oei minh 'nu Sư tơ kông.

English: Then He saw them straining at rowing, for the wind was against them. Now about the fourth watch of the night He came to them, walking on the sea, and would have passed them by.
Bahnar: Sư 'bôh lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư wơ̆r thŏng-nan anat anot dêh yua kơ kial tơhlu sơdrơ̆k. Na lăp tŏk-bŏk leng gong Yêsu jur đơ̆ng kông yak kơpal đak dơsĭ năm tơ lu sư. Sư wă năm brih ploi kơ lu sư.

English: And when they saw Him walking on the sea, they supposed it was a ghost, and cried out
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư 'bôh Sư yak kơpal đak dơsĭ, lu sư ngêh kơ atâu, lu sư hli dêh na ôr tơkĕch.

English: for they all saw Him and were troubled. But immediately He talked with them and said to them, “Be of good cheer! It is I; do not be afraid.”
Bahnar: Đĭ dôm lu sư 'bôh tôm, na lu sư hli tơrơ tơpă. Mă-lei Yêsu khan hloi kơ lu sư: “Iĕm 'nĕ pă hli âu, Inh lah.”

English: Then He went up into the boat to them, and the wind ceased. And they were greatly amazed in themselves beyond measure, and marveled.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu tŏk thŏng-nan hơdai păng lu sư, na kial thĕng hloi jua ưh pă đei tơhlu dơ̆ng. Lu sư sơleng kơ đon.

English: For they had not understood about the loaves, because their heart was hardened.
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ pơwao Yêsu gơh pơm tôm tơdrong thoi lĕ kơ 'bĕng mi Sư pơm mă hơdrol hei. Lu sư ưh kơ pơwao kơlih kơ lu sư kơhlôh.

English: When they had crossed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret and anchored there.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư tŏk hlôi kơ đak dơsĭ ei boih lu sư truh tơ tơring Gênêsaret, na 'măn lê̆ thŏng-nan lu sư tơ jih đak dơsĭ.

English: And when they came out of the boat, immediately the people recognized Him
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư jur đơ̆ng thŏng-nan, đe kơnăl hloi kơ Yêsu.

English: ran through that whole surrounding region, and began to carry about on beds those who were sick to wherever they heard He was.
Bahnar: Na lu đe ei kơdâu jơ̆p tơring ei chă roi kơ đe păng tung lu bơngai jĭ jăn păng anhŭn năm ba tơ Yêsu. Lu sư kơtơ̆ng Yêsu tơ yơ, lu sư kư̆m tung anhăk tơ ei mơ̆n.

English: Then the Pharisees and some of the scribes came together to Him, having come from Jerusalem.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Pharisi năm akŭm tơ Yêsu. Păng đei lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem kư̆m năm akŭm tơ Yêsu mơ̆n.

English: Now when they saw some of His disciples eat bread with defiled, that is, with unwashed hands, they found fault.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư akŭm, na lu sư 'bôh 'bar pêng 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu sŏng sa ti ưh kơ rơgoh yua kơ lu sư ưh kơ ôp ti kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong juăt lu bơngai Pharisi pơkă.

English: For the Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they wash their hands in a special way, holding the tradition of the elders.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Pharisi păng lu bơngai Juđê kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt lu yă 'bok sư ngăl, dah ưh kơ ôp ti kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong juăt lu sư pơkă, ưh kơ gơh sŏng sa.

English: When they come from the marketplace, they do not eat unless they wash. And there are many other things which they have received and hold, like the washing of cups, pitchers, copper vessels, and couches.
Bahnar: Rim lu sư wih đơ̆ng kơchơ, dah ưh kơ 'nhao, kư̆m ưh kơ gơh kơ sŏng sa. Păng lu sư kư̆m kiơ̆ lơ tơdrong juăt nai mơ̆n. Lu sư ling-lang 'nhao kơchŏk, 'nhao gŏ teh, 'nhao gŏ kong, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt lu sư pơkă.

English: Then the Pharisees and scribes asked Him, “Why do Your disciples not walk according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashed hands?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai khŭl Pharisi păng lu 'bok thây noh jet Yêsu: “Yua kơ kiơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Ih ưh kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt yă 'bok bơ̆n pơkă sơ̆, lu sư sŏng sa ưh kơ ôp ti?”

English: He answered and said to them, “Well did Isaiah prophesy of you hypocrites, as it is written: ‘This people honors Me with their lips, But their heart is far from Me.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Ơ bơngai 'bơ̆r đak klak ŭnh, Êsai chih nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei khan lê̆ hơdrol sơ̆ thoi âu na 'blep kơ iĕm dang ei tơpă: ‘Lu bơngai âu ư-ang kơ Inh păng 'bơ̆r đĕch, jơhngơ̆m klơm klak sư ataih đơ̆ng Inh.

English: And in vain they worship Me, Teaching as doctrines the commandments of men.’
Bahnar: Lu sư kơkuh kơ Inh ưh kơ yua kiơ. Lu sư bơtho tơdrong ala teh, mă-lei khan tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.’ ”

English: For laying aside the commandment of God, you hold the tradition of men—the washing of pitchers and cups, and many other such things you do.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng: “Iĕm tŭk tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă na kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong kon bơngai.

English: He said to them, “All too well you reject the commandment of God, that you may keep your tradition.
Bahnar: “Iĕm athei pơwao lăng bĕ, hăm 'lơ̆ng iĕm pơm thoi noh?

English: For Moses said, ‘Honor your father and your mother’; and, ‘He who curses father or mother, let him be put to death.’
Bahnar: Môis khan boih thoi âu: ‘Iĕm athei lui yom kơ lu mĕ 'bă păng dah bơngai bu pơma kơnê̆ kơ mĕ 'bă sư, athei pơlôch tŭk bơngai noh.’

English: But you say, ‘If a man says to his father or mother, “Whatever profit you might have received from me is Corban”—’ (that is, a gift to God)
Bahnar: Mă gah lu iĕm khan: ‘Bơngai bu khan kơ mĕ 'bă sư khan: Mŭk tơmam inh wă 'me sa biĕm ră, mă-lei inh pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĭ boih,’

English: then you no longer let him do anything for his father or his mother
Bahnar: na iĕm khan bơngai 'noh huay pă kăl kơ 'me sa mĕ 'bă sư dơ̆ng.

English: making the word of God of no effect through your tradition which you have handed down. And many such things you do.”
Bahnar: Iĕm pơjing tơdrong juăt bơtho đe thoi noh, na iĕm jing tŭk tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei boih păng iĕm kư̆m pơm lơ tơdrong nai ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng thoi noh mơ̆n.”

English: When He had called all the multitude to Himself, He said to them, “Hear Me, everyone, and understand
Bahnar: Na Yêsu krao đĭ bơngai kiơ̆ ei năm tơ Sư păng khan: “Đĭ kơ iĕm mơ̆ng Inh păng pơwao kơdih.

English: There is nothing that enters a man from outside which can defile him; but the things which come out of him, those are the things that defile a man.
Bahnar: Dôm lu tơmam sa kon bơngai sa, ưh kơ đei pơm kơ kon bơngai jing yoch ôh. Tơdrong pơm yoch noh lĕch đơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m kon bơngai na kon bơngai jing yoch.

English: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear!”
Bahnar: Bu đei đon athei tơchĕng kơdih bĕ.”

English: When He had entered a house away from the crowd, His disciples asked Him concerning the parable.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu tơklah đơ̆ng lu đe ei mơ̆t tơ hnam boih, na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư jet Sư tơdrong mă Sư pơtih gia 'noh hei.

English: So He said to them, “Are you thus without understanding also? Do you not perceive that whatever enters a man from outside cannot defile him
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Tơdrong pơtih gia 'noh hei iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ hlôh mơ̆n hă? Tơmam sa đơ̆ng 'ngoaih mơ̆t lăm klak kon bơngai ưh kơ gơh pơm kơ kon bơngai yoch ôh.

English: because it does not enter his heart but his stomach, and is eliminated, thus purifying all foods?”
Bahnar: Mă tơmam sa kiơ mơ̆t lăm klak kon bơngai ưh kơ sĭ mơ̆t lăm jơhngơ̆m sư pơm kơ sư jing yoch ôh. Tơmam sa mơ̆t lăm klak klaih kơ noh lĕch đĭ.” Thoi noh bơ̆n băt tôm kơ tơmam sa kiơ̆ kơ Yêsu khan tơmam sa rơgoh 'lơ̆ng ngăl ưh kơ đei giĕng kơ sa ôh.

English: And He said, “What comes out of a man, that defiles a man.
Bahnar: Sư khan dơ̆ng: “Mă tơdrong kiơ kiơ lĕch đơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m kon bơngai pơm kơ sư jing yoch.

English: For from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders
Bahnar: Yua kơ đơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m đon kon bơngai tơchĕng kơnê̆ na jing yoch: Sư pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, sư tơtông, sư pơlôch đe

English: thefts, covetousness, wickedness, deceit, lewdness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride, foolishness.
Bahnar: sư kơtrŏ păng akăn đe, sư 'nhĕng đe, sư pơm tôm tơdrong kơnê̆, sư pơma plơ̆ plĕch hơlĕnh pơdăr, sư pơma bâu roi đe, sư pơang akâu kơdih, sư pơm tôm tơdrong glăi răm.

English: All these evil things come from within and defile a man.”
Bahnar: Tôm tơdrong kơnê̆ noh lĕch đơ̆ng jơhngơ̆m đon kon bơngai ngăl. Dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ noh boih pơm kơ kon bơngai jing yoch.”

English: From there He arose and went to the region of Tyre and Sidon. And He entered a house and wanted no one to know it, but He could not be hidden.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Yêsu năm tơ tơring Pơlei Tirơ. Tơ ei Sư mơ̆t tơ hnam đe, kuă ăn tơring ei băt ră, mă-lei đe kư̆m oei băt kơ Sư.

English: For a woman whose young daughter had an unclean spirit heard about Him, and she came and fell at His feet.
Bahnar: Tơ tơring ei đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn đei kon adruh 'lơ̆p yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t. Na sư kơtơ̆ng ang đe khan Yêsu truh tơ tơring sư. Na sư năm 'nap 'bơ̆t anăp Yêsu.

English: The woman was a Greek, a Syro-Phoenician by birth, and she kept asking Him to cast the demon out of her daughter.
Bahnar: Bơngai drŏ-kăn ei bơngai Sirôphênis, tơring Tirơ, pơma nơ̆r Grĕk. Sư apinh Yêsu pơpuh yang kơnê̆ lĕch đơ̆ng kon sư.

English: But Jesus said to her, “Let the children be filled first, for it is not good to take the children’s bread and throw it to the little dogs.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Inh athei tơgŭm lu bơngai Juđê 'mơ̆i yua kơ lu sư dang kon Inh. Dah Inh tơgŭm ih bơngai tơmoi hơdrol, lei noh dang Inh klơ̆m tơmam sa kon Inh ăn kơ kŏ sa.”

English: And she answered and said to Him, “Yes, Lord, yet even the little dogs under the table eat from the children’s crumbs.”
Bahnar: Na bơngai drŏ-kăn ei khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok, trŏ boih, mă-lei inh wă kơ Ih tơgŭm inh 'biơ̆, yua kơ phŏ phŏ inh kư̆m 'bôh kŏ năm alep sa đêl kon hơ'lơ̆p sa asĭ.”

English: Then He said to her, “For this saying go your way; the demon has gone out of your daughter.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Ơ yă, yua kơ ih pơma trŏ thoi noh, na dang ei brŏk kơ ih bĕ. Yang kơnê̆ lĕch đĭ đơ̆ng akâu kon ih boih.”

English: And when she had come to her house, she found the demon gone out, and her daughter lying on the bed.
Bahnar: Na sư wih tơ hnam 'bôh hloi kon sư 'bĭch tơ giơng, yang kơnê̆ lĕch đĭ đơ̆ng akâu sư boih.

English: Again, departing from the region of Tyre and Sidon, He came through the midst of the region of Decapolis to the Sea of Galilee.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu năm đơ̆ng tơring Tirơ drong tơ tơring Siđôn păng tơring Đêkapôlis na wih tơ đak dơsĭ Galilê.

English: Then they brought to Him one who was deaf and had an impediment in his speech, and they begged Him to put His hand on him.
Bahnar: Tơ ei đe năm ba minh 'nu bơngai klĭk păng pơma arăk. Đe apinh Yêsu chro ti pel sư wă kơ sư klaih.

English: And He took him aside from the multitude, and put His fingers in his ears, and He spat and touched his tongue.
Bahnar: Yêsu anhăk bơngai klĭk ei đơ̆ng bơngai lơ tơ anih nai. Na Yêsu dan 'bơ̆t đon bơngai klĭk ei hơnglâu ti Sư kơdih păng Sư kơsoh đak hai 'bơ̆t ti Sư kơdih pik tơ hơpiĕt bơngai ei.

English: Then, looking up to heaven, He sighed, and said to him, “Ephphatha,” that is, “Be opened.”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu ngoi tơ plĕnh na tơhôih hăm khan kơ bơngai ei păng nơ̆r Juđê: “Eppatha” wă khan: “Đon ih hơbăng boih.”

English: Immediately his ears were opened, and the impediment of his tongue was loosed, and he spoke plainly.
Bahnar: Kơtă ei đon sư hơbăng hloi; păng hơpiĕt sư kư̆m rơmuăn mơ̆n na sư gơh pơma klŏ.

English: Then He commanded them that they should tell no one; but the more He commanded them, the more widely they proclaimed it.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “'Nĕ chă roi kơ đe.” Mă-lei lăp Yêsu khă lu sư, lu sư rai ră roi kơ đe.

English: And they were astonished beyond measure, saying, “He has done all things well. He makes both the deaf to hear and the mute to speak.”
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m băt chrêu kơ đon păng khan: “Yêsu gơh pơm tôm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpă iih? Sư pơm kơ bơngai klĭk klot gơh kơtơ̆ng, bơngai kơmlo mah gơh pơma.”

English: In those days, the multitude being very great and having nothing to eat, Jesus called His disciples to Him and said to them
Bahnar: Hơtai ei đei lơ bơngai năm akŭm tơ Sư dơ̆ng, kư̆m ưh kơ đei tơmam sa mơ̆n. Sư krao lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư na khan

English: “I have compassion on the multitude, because they have now continued with Me three days and have nothing to eat.
Bahnar: “Inh mơnat kơ lu bơngai tơpôl âu dêh oei hơdai bơ̆n pêng năr boih, tơmam sa lu sư đĭ pă đei boih.

English: And if I send them away hungry to their own houses, they will faint on the way; for some of them have come from afar.”
Bahnar: Dah bơ̆n tơwih lu sư klak hoh, ưh kơ jor lu sư rơmơ̆n rok trong, yua kơ đei lu mơ'nah đơ̆ng ataih tơpă adrin năm tơ âu.”

English: Then His disciples answered Him, “How can one satisfy these people with bread here in the wilderness?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan: “Thoi yơ bơ̆n gơh đei tơmam sa 'me lu sư yua kơ anih kueng chơngue thoi âu?”

English: He asked them, “How many loaves do you have?” And they said, “Seven.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu jet lu sư: “Iĕm đei dôm tŏ 'bĕng mi tơ âu?” Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan: “Tơpơh tŏ.”

English: So He commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground. And He took the seven loaves and gave thanks, broke them and gave them to His disciples to set before them; and they set them before the multitude.
Bahnar: Sư athei lu bơngai tơpôl ei tơoei tơ teh. Sư iŏk tơpơh tŏ 'bĕng mi 'noh, krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bă Sư 'Bok Kei-Dei, phĕ hloi 'bĕng mi noh ăn kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư chă asong kơ lu bơngai tơpôl ei; na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư chă asong kơ bôl buăl.

English: They also had a few small fish; and having blessed them, He said to set them also before them.
Bahnar: Lu sư kư̆m đei 'bar pêng găr ka iĕ iĕ. Yêsu krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bă Sư 'Bok Kei-Dei, na Sư athei lu sư chă asong kơ bôl buăl.

English: So they ate and were filled, and they took up seven large baskets of leftover fragments.
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai tơpôl ei sa phĭ mah rơkah rơkai boih, na lu sư dônh tah tơ bai 'bĕnh tơpơh tŏ bai 'bĕng mi păng ka rơkah.

English: Now those who had eaten were about four thousand. And He sent them away
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpôl ei dang puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai. Klaih kơ noh Yêsu tơwih đĭ lu bơngai tơpôl ei brŏk.

English: immediately got into the boat with His disciples, and came to the region of Dalmanutha.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu tŏk tơ thŏng-nan hơdai păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư năm tơ tơring Đalmanutha.

English: Then the Pharisees came out and began to dispute with Him, seeking from Him a sign from heaven, testing Him.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Pharisi năm tơ ei pơjah pơjăng hăm Yêsu. Lu sư apinh Yêsu pơm tơdrong mơsêh đơ̆ng plĕnh ti. Lu sư khan wă kơ băt Yêsu đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă dah ưh. Mă tơpă lu sư wă pơlong Yêsu hăm gơh pơm dah ưh.

English: But He sighed deeply in His spirit, and said, “Why does this generation seek a sign? Assuredly, I say to you, no sign shall be given to this generation.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu tơhôih păng khan: “Kơlih kơ kiơ jơhnơr iĕm ahrei wă apinh pơlong Inh pơm tơdrong mơsêh? Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, Inh ưh kơ wă pơm tơdrong mơsêh thoi iĕm apinh noh ôh.”

English: And He left them, and getting into the boat again, departed to the other side.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu tơklah đơ̆ng lu sư tŏk thŏng-nan tŏk pah to đak hơdai hăm lu bơngai pơhrăm hăm Sư.

English: Now the disciples had forgotten to take bread, and they did not have more than one loaf with them in the boat.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư hiơt kơ chĕp 'bĕng mi, lăm thŏng-nan oei pă minh pôm đĕch 'bĕng mi.

English: Then He charged them, saying, “Take heed, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and the leaven of Herod.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm athei kơchăng weh ataih kơ 'buih 'bĕng mi pông đe Pharisi păng 'buih 'bĕng mi pông Hêrôt.”

English: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, “It is because we have no bread.”
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong Sư pơma na chă pơma băl tơduă lu sư: “Sư pơma thoi noh, Sư jô̆ kơ bơ̆n hiơt kơ chĕp 'bĕng mi kơlĕ?”

English: But Jesus, being aware of it, said to them, “Why do you reason because you have no bread? Do you not yet perceive nor understand? Is your heart still hardened?
Bahnar: Yêsu băt kơ lu sư pơma gah tơdrong lu sư hiơt kơ chĕp 'bĕng mi, na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Lơliơ iĕm ngêh kơ Inh jô̆ kơ iĕm hiơt kơ chĕp 'bĕng mi? Iĕm ưh tam băt ôh hă Inh gơh pơm 'bĕng mi? Iĕm ưh tam hlôh tơpă dah kiơ? Lơliơ đon iĕm ưh kơ hlôh khŏm khŏm?

English: Having eyes, do you not see? And having ears, do you not hear? And do you not remember?
Bahnar: Iĕm kư̆m đei măt, lơliơ mă ưh kơ 'bôh? Iĕm kư̆m đei đon, lơliơ mă ưh kơtơ̆ng? Iĕm ưh kơ 'blŏk dah kiơ?

English: When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many baskets full of fragments did you take up?” They said to Him, “Twelve.”
Bahnar: Inh iŏk 'bĕng mi pơđăm tŏ, phĕ asong kơ pơđăm-rơbâu 'nu bơngai, iĕm dônh 'bĕnh rơkah tah dôm tŏ bai?” Lu sư khan: “Rơkah mơjĭt-'bar tŏ bai.”

English: “Also, when I broke the seven for the four thousand, how many large baskets full of fragments did you take up?” And they said, “Seven.”
Bahnar: “Bĭ đơ̆ng rŏng dơ̆ng Inh iŏk tơpơh tŏ 'bĕng mi phĕ asong kơ puăn-rơbâu 'nu bơngai, na iĕm dônh tah 'bĕnh dôm tŏ bai rơkah?” Lu sư khan: “Tơpơh tŏ bai.”

English: So He said to them, “How is it you do not understand?”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm tam mă hlôh 'mơ̆i dah kiơ?”

English: Then He came to Bethsaida; and they brought a blind man to Him, and begged Him to touch him.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh đe Yêsu năm tơ Pơlei 'Betsaiđa. Tơ ei đe năm ba minh 'nu bơngai măt tol tơ Yêsu, lu sư apinh Yêsu pel măt sư athei pơklaih ăn kơ sư.

English: So He took the blind man by the hand and led him out of the town. And when He had spit on his eyes and put His hands on him, He asked him if he saw anything.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu rôp ti sư chông ba tơ jih pơlei. Yêsu kơsoh đak hai kơ măt sư păng dan ti tơ măt sư na jet: “Ih hăm 'bôh kiơ kiơ ưh?”

English: And he looked up and said, “I see men like trees, walking.”
