Bahnar: Na sư ngoi khan kơ Yêsu: “Inh 'bôh đe yak mơ̆n, mă-lei akâu lu sư thoi lĕ kơ 'long.”

English: Then He put His hands on his eyes again and made him look up. And he was restored and saw everyone clearly.
Bahnar: Yêsu 'măn ti tơ măt sư minh 'măng dơ̆ng. Bơngai ei lăng 'bloh, măt sư klaih hloi păng 'bôh tôm tơdrong hơdah nhên.

English: Then He sent him away to his house, saying, “Neither go into the town, nor tell anyone in the town.”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu ăn kơ sư wih tơ hnam păng khan kơ sư: “Dang ei ih 'nĕ mơ̆t lăm Pơlei 'Betsaiđa âu dơ̆ng.”

English: Now Jesus and His disciples went out to the towns of Caesarea Philippi; and on the road He asked His disciples, saying to them, “Who do men say that I am?”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư yak đơ̆ng noh năm tơ jơ̆p pơlei đe tơring Sêsarê Philip. Kơplah lu sư oei rok trong Yêsu jet lu sư: “Đe khan Inh bu?”

English: So they answered, “John the Baptist; but some say, Elijah; and others, one of the prophets.”
Bahnar: Na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan: “Mơ'nah khan Ih Yôhan, bơngai mă pơm 'batem kơ đe. Mơ'nah khan Ih Êli, bơngai mă pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆. Mơ'nah dơ̆ng kư̆m khan Ih minh 'nu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei nai sơ̆.”

English: He said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered and said to Him, “You are the Christ.”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Bĭ iĕm khan Inh bu?” Na Pêtrôs khan: “Ih 'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh pơgơ̆r kon bơngai.”

English: Then He strictly warned them that they should tell no one about Him.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khă lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư kuă ăn chă roi kơ đe khan Sư 'Bok Krist.

English: And He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Inh Kon Bơngai gô đei tơdrong pơmat-tat. Lu đe kră sek tơlang, lu đe 'bok soi tih, lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê kuă chu yom kơ Inh na athei đe pơlôch Inh. Mă-lei kơtĕch pêng năr đơ̆ng rŏng Inh gô iung arih dơ̆ng.”

English: He spoke this word openly. Then Peter took Him aside and began to rebuke Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma hơdah tơdrong Sư thoi noh. Na Pêtrôs krao Yêsu weh ataih 'biơ̆ na khan kơ Sư: “Ih 'nĕ kơ pơma thoi noh.”

English: But when He had turned around and looked at His disciples, He rebuked Peter, saying, “Get behind Me, Satan! For you are not mindful of the things of God, but the things of men.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu hue lăng tơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư na khă hloi Pêtrôs: “Ơ Satan, jăk kơ e mă ataih đơ̆ng âu. E ưh kơ tơchĕng kiơ̆ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh, e tơchĕng kiơ̆ kơ kon bơngai đĕch.”

English: When He had called the people to Himself, with His disciples also, He said to them, “Whoever desires to come after Me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow Me.
Bahnar: Yêsu krao bơngai tơpôl lơ păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư mơ̆n năm tơ Sư. Na Sư khan: “Dah bơngai bu wă kiơ̆ Inh, sư athei tŭk đĭ tơdrong sư kơdih păng tôi kơdih 'long pơglang chu lôch yua kơ wă kiơ̆ Inh.

English: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for My sake and the gospel’s will save it.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ưh kơ chu lôch yua kơ tơdrong Inh, bơngai noh gô lôch hoh hoh đĕch ưh kơ yua kiơ. Bơngai bu chu lôch yua kơ tơdrong Inh păng tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng, sư 'noh gô arih ling-lang.

English: For what will it profit a man if he gains the whole world, and loses his own soul?
Bahnar: Mă bu mơdrŏng đei tôm mŭk tơmam tơ ala teh âu, dah sư ưh kơ arih ling-lang, lei truh sư lôch, ưh pă đei yua kiơ boih.

English: Or what will a man give in exchange for his soul?
Bahnar: Mă sư mơdrŏng kư̆m ưh kơ gơh răt tơdrong arih sư ôh.

English: For whoever is ashamed of Me and My words in this adulterous and sinful generation, of him the Son of Man also will be ashamed when He comes in the glory of His Father with the holy angels.”
Bahnar: Ning-mônh Inh Kon Bơngai gô jur tơ ala teh âu hơdai păng lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng. Năr 'noh kơnh 'Bă Inh gô ăn kơ Inh mơsêh mơyang 'lơ̆ng rŏ tơpă. Na bơngai bu kiơ̆ Inh boih, mă-lei sư kơdơ̆ mơlâu kơ lu bơngai kơnê̆ tam lui na sư kuă kơ bơtho lu sư tơdrong Inh, năr 'noh kơnh Inh kư̆m kuă kơ sư mơ̆n.”

English: And He said to them, “Assuredly, I say to you that there are some standing here who will not taste death till they see the kingdom of God present with power.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, đei lăm lu iĕm âu mơ'nah ưh tam lôch ôh, lu sư gô 'bôh tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r hăm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Sư.

English: Now after six days Jesus took Peter, James, and John, and led them up on a high mountain apart by themselves; and He was transfigured before them.
Bahnar: Tơdrâu năr đơ̆ng rŏng kơ năr noh, Yêsu anhăk Pêtrôs, Yakơ hăm Yôhan lu sư tŏk tơ kông kơjung kơdrô̆ dôm lu sư âu. Na Yêsu tơwir akâu Sư kơdih 'bơ̆t anăp lu đe pêng 'nu noh.

English: His clothes became shining, exceedingly white, like snow, such as no launderer on earth can whiten them.
Bahnar: Ao Yêsu jing rang kok tôch tơdrong kok.

English: And Elijah appeared to them with Moses, and they were talking with Jesus.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh 'bôh blư kơ Môis păng Êli jur pơma dơnuh hăm Yêsu.

English: Then Peter answered and said to Jesus, “Rabbi, it is good for us to be here; and let us make three tabernacles: one for You, one for Moses, and one for Elijah”
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, bơ̆n oei tơ âu hiôk dêh. Lê̆ kơ nhôn pơm kơ bơ̆n pêng tŏ bơsŭn; minh pôm pơm kơ Ih, minh pôm pơm kơ Môis, minh pôm pơm kơ Êli.”

English: because he did not know what to say, for they were greatly afraid.
Bahnar: Pêtrôs sư pơma thoi noh yua kơ sư ưh pă gơh pơma thoi yơ boih kơlih kơ lu sư hli dêh.

English: And a cloud came and overshadowed them; and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, “This is My beloved Son. Hear Him!”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh 'bôh glĭp kơ hơmơ̆l jur gom lu sư. Păng đei nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma đơ̆ng lăm hơmơ̆l ei khan: “Sư âu Kon Inh mă 'mêm kơeng tơpă. Na iĕm ling-lang athei chu yom kơ Sư.”

English: Suddenly, when they had looked around, they saw no one anymore, but only Jesus with themselves.
Bahnar: Lu sư kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma thoi noh hloi chă hue-huo lăng ră jua ưh kơ 'bôh bu dơ̆ng hơdai păng Yêsu dơ̆ng, pă minh 'nu Sư đĕch oei 'bơ̆t ei.

English: Now as they came down from the mountain, He commanded them that they should tell no one the things they had seen, till the Son of Man had risen from the dead.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh lu sư jur đơ̆ng kông noh na Yêsu khă lu sư thoi âu: “Iĕm 'nĕ chă roi kơ đe hŏ dôm tơdrong iĕm 'bôh hei, đơ̆ng dang ei truh Inh Kon Bơngai iung arih đơ̆ng lôch ning-mônh.”

English: So they kept this word to themselves, questioning what the rising from the dead meant.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lu sư ôn tơdrong 'noh tơtăm lu sư kơdih. Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ băt ôh akâu Yêsu gô lôch iung arih noh, na lu sư jet tơduă lu sư wă kơ băt tơdrong Yêsu khan: “Truh Inh Kon Bơngai iung arih đơ̆ng lôch ning-mônh.”

English: And they asked Him, saying, “Why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?”
Bahnar: Na lu sư jet Yêsu: “Lơliơ lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê khan Êli gô jur tơ teh hơdrol kơ 'Bok Krist?”

English: Then He answered and told them, “Indeed, Elijah is coming first and restores all things. And how is it written concerning the Son of Man, that He must suffer many things and be treated with contempt?
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Trŏ boih Êli jur tơ teh hơdrol kơ 'Bok Krist, yua kơ sư hơmet ming tôm tơdrong hơdrol. Na Inh kư̆m wă jet iĕm mơ̆n: Yua kơ kiơ sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei chih khan lê̆ hơdrol kơ Inh Kon Bơngai gô đei tơdrong pơmat-tat păng tơdrong đe hil areh kơ Inh?

English: But I say to you that Elijah has also come, and they did to him whatever they wished, as it is written of him.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, Êli truh boih păng đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ sư kiơ̆ gô mơ̆ng kơ đe wă, kư̆m thoi đe chih roi lê̆ hơdrol gah tơdrong sư lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆.”

English: And when He came to the disciples, He saw a great multitude around them, and scribes disputing with them.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư brŏk tơ lu buăl pơhrăm păng sư wă jê̆ truh boih, na lu sư 'bôh bơngai tơpôl lơ akŭm tăp dăr kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư mă oei tơ ei. Đei lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê oei pơjah pơjăng păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu mă oei tơ ei.

English: Immediately, when they saw Him, all the people were greatly amazed, and running to Him, greeted Him.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư 'bôh Yêsu, lu sư kơdrăt na pơm kơdâu năm tơkan tơ Yêsu kơkuh kơ Yêsu.

English: And He asked the scribes, “What are you discussing with them?”
Bahnar: Yêsu jet lu sư: “Iĕm pơjah pơjăng tơdrong kiơ?”

English: Then one of the crowd answered and said, “Teacher, I brought You my son, who has a mute spirit.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu lăm bơngai tơpôl ei đĕch tơl wă apinh Yêsu pơklaih kon sư. Sư khan: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, inh đei anhăk kon drŏ-nglo inh tơ Ih. Sư bơngai yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t pơm kơ sư kơmlo.

English: And wherever it seizes him, it throws him down; he foams at the mouth, gnashes his teeth, and becomes rigid. So I spoke to Your disciples, that they should cast it out, but they could not.”
Bahnar: Mă tơ yơ yơ mưh yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t lăm akâu sư, yang kơnê̆ glơ̆m sư pơ̆k na sư lĕch đak hai djơdjih djơdjah păng tơkăp sơnĕnh kơkrit kơkrat jing arăng jơ'mro. Na inh apinh lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Ih pơpuh yang kơnê̆ lĕch đơ̆ng akâu sư ră lu sư ưh kơ gơh.”

English: He answered him and said, “O faithless generation, how long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you? Bring him to Me.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Ơ lu iĕm mă oei lui rơdu hơnơ̆ng, iĕm wă kơ Inh oei hơdai iĕm đunh dang yơ 'mơ̆i, na iĕm lui kơjăp? Iĕm wă kơ Inh gleh dang yơ 'mơ̆i na iĕm gơh pơklaih đe?” Na Yêsu khan kơ bơngai ei: “Năm ba kon ih tơ âu năm.”

English: Then they brought him to Him. And when he saw Him, immediately the spirit convulsed him, and he fell on the ground and wallowed, foaming at the mouth.
Bahnar: Na đe năm ba 'lơ̆p ei tơ Sư. Lăp yang kơnê̆ 'bôh Yêsu, yang kơnê̆ glơ̆m 'lơ̆p ei tơgrŏl hloi akâu sư kơdih. Đak hai sư lĕch djơdjih djơdjah.

English: So He asked his father, “How long has this been happening to him?” And he said, “From childhood.
Bahnar: Yêsu jet 'Bă sư: “Sư thoi âu tam đunh ưh?” 'Bă sư khan: “Đơ̆ng sư oei iĕ sơ̆.

English: And often he has thrown him both into the fire and into the water to destroy him. But if You can do anything, have compassion on us and help us.”
Bahnar: Yang kơnê̆ ngăl glơ̆m sư tơ ŭnh, phŏ lăm đak wă pơlôch sư. Na dang ei dah Ih gơh pơklaih, apinh Ih mơnat kơ nhôn, tơgŭm nhôn 'biơ̆.”

English: Jesus said to him, “If you can believe, all things are possible to him who believes.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Dah ih đei đon lui, lei kon ih gô klaih. Bơngai bu đei đon lui, bơngai 'noh sư gơh pơm tôm tơdrong.”

English: Immediately the father of the child cried out and said with tears, “Lord, I believe; help my unbelief!”
Bahnar: 'Bă bơngai 'lơ̆p yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t ei pơma hloi 'bơ̆r re khan: “Inh lui mơ̆n mă-lei oei rơdu. Apinh Ih pơm ăn kơ inh lui mă kơjăp.”

English: When Jesus saw that the people came running together, He rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to it: “Deaf and dumb spirit, I command you, come out of him and enter him no more!”
Bahnar: Yêsu 'bôh đe tơpôl rĭ rai jê̆ Sư na Sư wă jah keh tơdrong 'noh. Na Sư pơpuh hloi yang kơnê̆ ei khan: “Ơ yang kơnê̆ ngăl pơm kơ đe kơmlo păng klĭk, Inh pơpuh e lĕch jăk đơ̆ng sư âu, 'nĕ pă mơ̆t oei lăm akâu sư dơ̆ng.”

English: Then the spirit cried out, convulsed him greatly, and came out of him. And he became as one dead, so that many said, “He is dead.”
Bahnar: Yang kơnê̆ hmoi pơret pơm kơ sư pơtơ̆l, na lĕch jăk hloi đơ̆ng akâu bơngai 'lơ̆p ei. Na bơngai 'lơ̆p ei đe lăng sư nhen lôch na đĭ-đăng kơ đe khan: “'Noh sư lôch boih.”

English: But Jesus took him by the hand and lifted him up, and he arose.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu rôp ti sư dui tơiung sư, na sư iung hloi.

English: And when He had come into the house, His disciples asked Him privately, “Why could we not cast it out?”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Yêsu mơ̆t tơ hnam, na lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư jet Sư kơdrô̆: “Yua kơ kiơ nhôn ưh kơ gơh pơpuh yang kơnê̆?”

English: So He said to them, “This kind can come out by nothing but prayer and fasting.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Yang kơnê̆ thoi âu, dah bơ̆n ưh kơ krao khan kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei hơdrol, mă bơ̆n pơpuh lap đĕch, sư ưh kơ chu kơdâu ôh.”

English: Then they departed from there and passed through Galilee, and He did not want anyone to know it.
Bahnar: Lu sư yak đơ̆ng anih 'noh năm mơ̆t tơ dêh Galilê yak yoh hloi yua kơ Yêsu kuă ăn đe băt

English: For He taught His disciples and said to them, “The Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of men, and they will kill Him. And after He is killed, He will rise the third day.”
Bahnar: kơlih kơ Sư bơtho lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan: “Đe gô rôp pơjao Inh Kon Bơngai tơ ti kon bơngai tơ ala teh âu. Lu đe ei boih pơlôch Inh. Lăp đe pơlôch Inh boih, kơtĕch pêng năr đơ̆ng rŏng Inh iung arih dơ̆ng.”

English: But they did not understand this saying, and were afraid to ask Him.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ hlôh ôh Yêsu pơma thoi noh păng ưh kơ pơ̆n jet Sư tăm.

English: Then He came to Capernaum. And when He was in the house He asked them, “What was it you disputed among yourselves on the road?”
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư truh tơ Pơlei Kapernum boih, kơplah Yêsu oei lăm hnam, Sư jet lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “Iĕm pơma pơjah pơjăng băl tơdrong kiơ kơplah bơ̆n oei năm rok trong hei?”

English: But they kept silent, for on the road they had disputed among themselves who would be the greatest.
Bahnar: Lu sư thĕng ưh kơ pơ̆n roi kơ Sư, yua kơ kơplah rok trong hei lu sư pơma pơjah pơjăng dih băl tơpă, lu sư wă kơ băt bu pơm tih 'biơ̆ kơ tơduă lu sư.

English: And He sat down, called the twelve, and said to them, “If anyone desires to be first, he shall be last of all and servant of all.”
Bahnar: Yêsu tơoei păng krao mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư. Na Sư khan: “Dah bu wă pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lu iĕm, bơngai 'noh athei pơm thoi lĕ đĭch đam kơ đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm.”

English: Then He took a little child and set him in the midst of them. And when He had taken him in His arms, He said to them
Bahnar: Na Yêsu năm dui iŏk minh 'nu bơngai 'lơ̆p, ăn kơ sư oei tŏk-bŏk lu sư. Yêsu pôk bơngai 'lơ̆p 'noh na khan kơ bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư

English: “Whoever receives one of these little children in My name receives Me; and whoever receives Me, receives not Me but Him who sent Me.”
Bahnar: “Dah bu sơng iŏk bơngai 'lơ̆p âu yua kơ bơngai 'lơ̆p âu lui kơ Inh, sư 'noh dang sơng iŏk Inh. Sư 'noh ưh kơ sĭ sơng iŏk Inh đĕch ôh, sư 'noh dang sơng iŏk 'Bok Kei-Dei mă wơh Inh mơ̆n.”

English: Now John answered Him, saying, “Teacher, we saw someone who does not follow us casting out demons in Your name, and we forbade him because he does not follow us.”
Bahnar: Na Yôhan khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, nhôn 'bôh minh 'nu bơngai gơnang kơ anăn Ih wă pơpuh yang kơnê̆ đơ̆ng đe na nhôn khă sư yua kơ sư ưh kơ jang hơdai bơ̆n.”

English: But Jesus said, “Do not forbid him, for no one who works a miracle in My name can soon afterward speak evil of Me.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Yêsu khan: “'Nĕ pă khă sư, yua kơ bơngai mă gơnang kơ Inh tơgŭm sư pơm tơdrong mơsêh mơyang, kơplah noh sư ưh kơ bâu roi Inh ôh.

English: For he who is not against us is on our side.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu huay kơ ayăt kơ bơ̆n, bơngai 'noh kiơ̆ đon bơ̆n.

English: For whoever gives you a cup of water to drink in My name, because you belong to Christ, assuredly, I say to you, he will by no means lose his reward.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, bơngai bu hơlăng kơ iĕm, asong iĕm minh kơchŏk đak nhă yua kơ iĕm kiơ̆ Inh 'Bok Krist, bơngai 'noh 'Bok Kei-Dei gô apah sư tơpă.

English: “But whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in Me to stumble, it would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were thrown into the sea.
Bahnar: “Bơngai bu pơtuah bơngai 'lơ̆p mă lui kơ Inh thoi âu boih, pơtih gia đe dah chô̆ ako sư tơ tơpăl tơmo tih sơ̆, hơtat lê̆ sư tơ klŏng đak dơsĭ, lei sư hiôk 'biơ̆ yua kơ sư huay kơ gơh pơtuah lu hơ'lơ̆p dang ei.

English: If your hand causes you to sin, cut it off. It is better for you to enter into life maimed, rather than having two hands, to go to hell, into the fire that shall never be quenched
Bahnar: “Dah minh pah ti iĕm pơm kơ iĕm yoch, chơ̆ng lê̆ minh pah ti iĕm 'noh, na oei pă minh pah 'noh iĕm gơh mơ̆t oei păng 'Bok Kei-Dei. 'Noh 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ iĕm oei tôm 'bar pah ti ră, mă-lei wă huŏng lăm dơnâu ŭnh mă ưh kơ layơ păt.

English: where ‘Their worm does not die And the fire is not quenched.’
Bahnar: Lăm dơnâu ŭnh ei boih đei hrai mă ưh kơ lôch wă sa lu bơngai mă huŏng lăm dơnâu ŭnh ei; păng ŭnh ei ưh kơ layơ păt hơngăm.

English: And if your foot causes you to sin, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life lame, rather than having two feet, to be cast into hell, into the fire that shall never be quenched
Bahnar: Dah minh pah jơ̆ng iĕm pơm kơ iĕm yoch, chơ̆ng lê̆ minh pah jơ̆ng iĕm 'noh, na oei pă minh pah 'noh iĕm gơh mơ̆t oei păng 'Bok Kei-Dei. 'Noh 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ iĕm oei tôm 'bar pah jơ̆ng ră mă-lei wă huŏng lăm dơnâu ŭnh.

English: where ‘Their worm does not die, And the fire is not quenched.’
Bahnar: Lăm dơnâu ŭnh ei đei hrai mă ưh kơ lôch wă sa lu bơngai mă huŏng lăm dơnâu ŭnh ei; păng ŭnh ei ưh kơ layơ păt hơngăm.

English: And if your eye causes you to sin, pluck it out. It is better for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye, rather than having two eyes, to be cast into hell fire
Bahnar: Dah minh pah măt iĕm pơm kơ iĕm yoch, kuek hŭt minh pah măt iĕm 'noh, na oei pă minh pah 'noh iĕm gơh mơ̆t oei lăm dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei. 'Noh 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ iĕm oei tôm 'bar pah măt, mă-lei wă huŏng lăm dơnâu ŭnh.

English: where ‘Their worm does not die And the fire is not quenched.’
Bahnar: Lăm dơnâu ŭnh ei boih đei hrai mă ưh kơ lôch wă sa lu bơngai mă huŏng lăm dơnâu ŭnh ei; păng ŭnh ei ưh kơ layơ păt hơngăm.

English: “For everyone will be seasoned with fire, and every sacrifice will be seasoned with salt.
Bahnar: “Đĭ rim 'nu kon bơngai gô đei tơdrong gleh pơmat-tat.

English: Salt is good, but if the salt loses its flavor, how will you season it? Have salt in yourselves, and have peace with one another.”
Bahnar: “'Boh tah kơ tơmam sa bơ̆n 'băt 'lơ̆ng păng săt ling-lang. Mă-lei dah 'boh jing sap bơ̆n ưh kơ đei kiơ wă pơm kơ 'boh 'băt dơ̆ng. Bơ̆n băt kơ 'boh tah kơ tơmam sa bơ̆n 'băt 'lơ̆ng, na iĕm athei pơm jơhngơ̆m đon dim hiôk hơiă dih băl ling-lang kư̆m thoi tơmam sa tah 'boh oei săt khŏm khŏm.”

English: Then He arose from there and came to the region of Judea by the other side of the Jordan. And multitudes gathered to Him again, and as He was accustomed, He taught them again.
Bahnar: Yêsu năm đơ̆ng Pơlei Kapernum ei mơ̆t brih lăm dêh Juđê păng hơloh năm hloi tơ dêh pah to krong Jôrđăn. Tơ ei đei lơ bơngai năm akŭm tơ Sư dơ̆ng, na Sư bơtho đe kư̆m thoi krô hmă.

English: The Pharisees came and asked Him, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?” testing Him.
Bahnar: Đei bơngai Pharisi năm jet pơlong Sư wă kơ Sư pơma ưh kơ trŏ tơdrong juăt. Lu sư jet thoi âu: “Kiơ̆ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n hăm gơh achăng akăn?”

English: And He answered and said to them, “What did Moses command you?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan: “Môis pơkă kơ iĕm sơ̆ liơ?”

English: They said, “Moses permitted a man to write a certificate of divorce, and to dismiss her.”
Bahnar: “Môis pơkă kơ nhôn sơ̆ athei drŏ-nglo bơ̆n pơm hla bơar mă trŏ na gơh achăng akăn sư.”

English: And Jesus answered and said to them, “Because of the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “'Noh yua kơ yă 'bok iĕm sơ̆ arăng kơ̆l na Môis pơkă kơ iĕm thoi noh.

English: But from the beginning of the creation, God ‘made them male and female.’
Bahnar: Blŭng-a sơ̆, ‘'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing minh 'nu drŏ-nglo, minh 'nu drŏ-kăn.’

English: ‘For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife
Bahnar: ‘Yua kơ thoi noh na bơngai drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn tơklah đơ̆ng mĕ 'bă sư kơdih na oei hơdai.

English: and the two shall become one flesh’; so then they are no longer two, but one flesh.
Bahnar: Na bre sư jing minh sĕch, minh akar.’ Bre sư ưh pă thoi 'bar 'nu bơngai boih, bre sư thoi minh 'nu bơngai đĕch.

English: Therefore what God has joined together, let not man separate.”
Bahnar: Yua thoi noh na kon bơngai bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh achăng lê̆ akăn sư ôh, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆p bre sư jing klo kăn boih.”

English: In the house His disciples also asked Him again about the same matter.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư brŏk tơ hnam lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư jet Sư tơdrong 'noh dơ̆ng.

English: So He said to them, “Whoever divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery against her.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Bơngai bu mă achăng lê̆ akăn sư na iŏk akăn plơ̆ng, drŏ-nglo 'noh yoch boih yua kơ sư dang kơđang kơ̆l ako 'brơh kơ akăn sư.

English: And if a woman divorces her husband and marries another, she commits adultery.”
Bahnar: Dah drŏ-kăn achăng lê̆ klo sư, na iŏk klo plơ̆ng, drŏ-kăn 'noh kư̆m yoch mơ̆n yua kơ sư dang kơđang kơ̆l ako 'brơh kơ klo sư.”

English: Then they brought little children to Him, that He might touch them; but the disciples rebuked those who brought them.
Bahnar: Đe anhăk ba lu hơ'lơ̆p tơ Yêsu wă kơ Sư pel kơ̆l krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei apinh Sư wei-lăng lu sư. Mă-lei lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khă kuă ăn năm tơ Sư.

English: But when Jesus saw it, He was greatly displeased and said to them, “Let the little children come to Me, and do not forbid them; for of such is the kingdom of God.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu 'bôh lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư pơm thoi noh, Sư hil păng khan: “Lê̆ lu hơ'lơ̆p năm tơ Inh, 'nĕ pă khă lu sư, yua kơ bơngai bu lui thoi lu hơ'lơ̆p âu lui, bơngai 'noh 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r wei-lăng sư ling-lang.

English: Assuredly, I say to you, whoever does not receive the kingdom of God as a little child will by no means enter it.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, bơngai bu ưh kơ wă lui thoi lu hơ'lơ̆p lui, bơngai 'noh 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ pơgơ̆r sư ôh.”

English: And He took them up in His arms, laid His hands on them, and blessed them.
Bahnar: Yêsu pôk lu hơ'lơ̆p noh, pel kơ̆l, na krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wei-lăng lu sư.

English: Now as He was going out on the road, one came running, knelt before Him, and asked Him, “Good Teacher, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?”
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu wă yak đơ̆ng ei Sư tơ'bơ̆p minh 'nu bơngai kơdâu tơkan năm tơ Sư, sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng 'bơ̆t anăp Sư păng jet Sư thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, Ih 'lơ̆ng tơpăt; inh pơm thoi yơ wă kơ oei hơdai hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei na arih ling-lang?”

English: So Jesus said to him, “Why do you call Me good? No one is good but One, that is, God.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Yua kơ kiơ ih khan Inh bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt? Kon bơngai ưh kơ đei bu 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ôh, pôm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch 'lơ̆ng tơpăt.

English: You know the commandments: ‘Do not commit adultery,’ ‘Do not murder,’ ‘Do not steal,’ ‘Do not bear false witness,’ ‘Do not defraud,’ ‘Honor your father and your mother.’ ”
Bahnar: Ih băt boih tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă sơ̆: ‘'Nĕ pơlôch bơngai, 'nĕ pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, 'nĕ chă tơtông tơmam đe, 'nĕ pơma hơlĕnh, 'nĕ pơgâm sa mŭk tơmam đe, bơ̆n athei lui yom kơ mĕ 'bă.’ ”

English: And he answered and said to Him, “Teacher, all these things I have kept from my youth.”
Bahnar: Na 'bok mơdrŏng ei khan: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, dôm tơdrong 'noh inh huay ră mă đơ̆ng inh oei iĕ sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei.”

English: Then Jesus, looking at him, loved him, and said to him, “One thing you lack: Go your way, sell whatever you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, take up the cross, and follow Me.”
Bahnar: Yêsu lăng 'bok mơdrŏng noh, Sư 'mêm tơpă na Sư khan thoi âu: “Ih răk ưh kơ tôm oei pă minh tơdrong. Ih athei tĕch đĭ mŭk tơmam ih chă asong kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin na kiơ̆ hloi Inh. Thoi noh na ih gô đei mŭk tơmam tơ kơpal plĕnh ti ning-mônh.”

English: But he was sad at this word, and went away sorrowful, for he had great possessions.
Bahnar: Yêsu pơma thoi noh, na 'bok mơdrŏng ei sơ'nhoi. Sư sơ'ngon dêh kơlih kơ sư đei mŭk tơmam lơ tơpă, na sư brŏk hloi.

English: Then Jesus looked around and said to His disciples, “How hard it is for those who have riches to enter the kingdom of God!”
Bahnar: Yêsu hue lăng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư na khan: “Lu bơngai mơdrŏng wă mơ̆t tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r anat dêh.”

English: And the disciples were astonished at His words. But Jesus answered again and said to them, “Children, how hard it is for those who trust in riches to enter the kingdom of God!
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư sơleng kơ đon ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong Sư pơma âu. Mă-lei Yêsu khan dơ̆ng kơ lu sư: “Ơ lu kon Inh, anat dêh mơ̆t tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.”
Bahnar: Aseh lăk-đa mơ̆t bơlôh jrŭm 'bônh 'biơ̆ kơ bơngai mơdrŏng wă mơ̆t tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: And they were greatly astonished, saying among themselves, “Who then can be saved?”
Bahnar: Lu sư mơ̆ng rai sơleng kơ đon na jet Yêsu: “Lei bu gơh mơ̆t tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei lĕ?”

English: But Jesus looked at them and said, “With men it is impossible, but not with God; for with God all things are possible.”
Bahnar: Yêsu lăng lu sư păng khan: “Kon bơngai ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t kơdih tơ dêh char 'Bok Kei-Dei ôh, dah 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ pơklaih yoch sư. 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih yoch sư na sư gơh mơ̆t yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei gơh pơm tôm tơdrong.”

English: Then Peter began to say to Him, “See, we have left all and followed You.”
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs khan kơ Sư: “Bĭ lu nhôn mă achăng lê̆ tôm tơdrong yua kơ kiơ̆ Ih boih lơliơ?”

English: So Jesus answered and said, “Assuredly, I say to you, there is no one who has left house or brothers or sisters or father or mother or wife or children or lands, for My sake and the gospel’s
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, bơngai bu achăng lê̆ hnam sư, 'nhŏng oh sư, mĕ 'bă sư, kon sư, mir 'ba sư, yua kơ sư wă jang tơdrong Inh păng ră roi tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng kơ đe

English: who shall not receive a hundredfold now in this time—houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and lands, with persecutions—and in the age to come, eternal life.
Bahnar: bơngai 'noh dang ei 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm sư hloh loi kơ sư tam mă lui sơ̆, mă hnam, mă 'nhŏng oh, mă mĕ 'bă, mă kon, mă mir 'ba, sư gô đei lơ hloh kơ sơ̆ tơpă. Sư kư̆m đei tơdrong anat anot yua kơ jang tơdrong Inh kơplah dang ei mơ̆n. Mă-lei ning-mônh sư gô arih ling-lang ưh kơ đei layơ tôch.

English: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.”
Bahnar: Kư̆m đei lơ bơngai pơm tih dang ei, ning-mônh sư jing iĕ. Kư̆m đei lơ bơngai jang tơdrong iĕ dang ei, ning-mônh gô jang tơdrong tih.”

English: Now they were on the road, going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus was going before them; and they were amazed. And as they followed they were afraid. Then He took the twelve aside again and began to tell them the things that would happen to Him
Bahnar: Lu sư oei yak rok trong năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Yêsu yak hơdrol kơ đe. Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư mah prưn kơ jơhngơ̆m păng lu bơngai nai kư̆m hli mơ̆n. Yêsu anhăk lu mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư weh ataih 'biơ̆ kơ đe thoi ki dơ̆ng. Na Sư roi tôm tơdrong pơmat Sư gô tơ'bơ̆p.

English: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and the Son of Man will be betrayed to the chief priests and to the scribes; and they will condemn Him to death and deliver Him to the Gentiles
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Iĕm mơ̆ng bĕ. Bơ̆n năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Tơ ei kơnh đe wă rôp Inh Kon Bơngai, jao kơ lu 'bok soi tih păng lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê. Lu sư gô sek tơlang tơdrong Inh, jao Inh kơ lu bơngai dêh đe pơlôch.

English: and they will mock Him, and scourge Him, and spit on Him, and kill Him. And the third day He will rise again.”
Bahnar: Lu dêh đe ei gô hiĕk achơ̆ kơ Inh, kơsoh pơ'brơh kơ Inh đak hai păng teh tach pơjĭ Inh, klaih kơ noh pơlôch hloi. Mă-lei kơtĕch pêng năr đơ̆ng rŏng Inh gô iung arih dơ̆ng.”

English: Then James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to Him, saying, “Teacher, we want You to do for us whatever we ask.”
Bahnar: Yakơ păng Yôhan, bre kon Sêbêđê, bre sư năm jê̆ 'bơ̆t Yêsu na khan kơ Sư: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, nhi wă kơ Ih ăn kơ nhi tơdrong nhi apinh.”

English: And He said to them, “What do you want Me to do for you?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ bre sư: “Biĕm wă kơ Inh ăn tơdrong kiơ?”

English: They said to Him, “Grant us that we may sit, one on Your right hand and the other on Your left, in Your glory.”
Bahnar: Bre sư khan: “Apinh Ih ăn kơ nhi ngôi minh 'nu gah 'ma, minh 'nu gah 'ngiĕo Ih kơplah Ih pơm Pơtao nhôn.”

English: But Jesus said to them, “You do not know what you ask. Are you able to drink the cup that I drink, and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ bre sư: “Liơ biĕm ưh kơ pơwao tơdrong biĕm apinh noh? Biĕm hăm kĕ iŏk tơdrong anat thoi Inh gô iŏk? Biĕm hăm kĕ chu lôch thoi Inh gô chu?”

English: They said to Him, “We are able.” So Jesus said to them, “You will indeed drink the cup that I drink, and with the baptism I am baptized with you will be baptized
Bahnar: Bre sư khan: “Nhi chu kĕ.” Yêsu khan dơ̆ng kơ bre sư: “Biĕm gô iŏk tơdrong anat thoi Inh wă iŏk. Biĕm gô chu lôch thoi Inh gô chu lôch mơ̆n.”

English: but to sit on My right hand and on My left is not Mine to give, but it is for those for whom it is prepared.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdrong pơm tih oei gah 'ma gah 'ngiĕo kơ Inh noh, ưh kơ trŏ kơ Inh ăn ôh, tơdrong noh gô mơ̆ng kơ 'Bă Inh đĕch băt.

English: And when the ten heard it, they began to be greatly displeased with James and John.
Bahnar: Na lu mơjĭt 'nu lu bôl sư kơtơ̆ng bre sư pơma thoi noh, lu sư hil kơ bre Yakơ hăm Yôhan.

English: But Jesus called them to Himself and said to them, “You know that those who are considered rulers over the Gentiles lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Yêsu krao akŭm pơđĭ lu sư păng khan: “Iĕm băt mơ̆n teh đak đe, lu bơngai mă pơm 'bok pơgơ̆r, sư chă wơh pơgŏ lu bơngai sư wei. Lu pơm 'bok tih chă pơjuă pơđep đe.

English: Yet it shall not be so among you; but whoever desires to become great among you shall be your servant.
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm 'nĕ kơ rok lu 'bok pơgơ̆r noh hŏ. Bơngai bu 'maih pơm 'bok tih lăm lu iĕm, bơngai 'noh athei pơm thoi lĕ đĭch đam iĕm.

English: And whoever of you desires to be first shall be slave of all.
Bahnar: Dah bơngai bu lăm lu iĕm 'maih pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lu iĕm, bơngai 'noh athei pơm thoi lĕ đĭch đam đĭ-đăng kơ lu iĕm.

English: For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give His life a ransom for many.”
Bahnar: Kư̆m thoi Inh Kon Bơngai mơ̆n, Inh jur tơ ala teh âu ưh kơ sĭ Inh wă chă pơgŏ pơđep đe awih awăn kơ Inh ôh; Inh wă kơ tơ'ngla Inh kơdih awih awăn kơ đe păng Inh wă kơ tơ'ngla Inh kơdih lôch tang huai iŏk lơ bơngai.”

English: Now they came to Jericho. As He went out of Jericho with His disciples and a great multitude, blind Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, sat by the road begging.
Bahnar: Lu sư truh tơ Pơlei Jêrikô. Yêsu păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư yak đơ̆ng pơlei 'noh hơdai hăm đe tơpôl lơ. Tơ anăp lu sư đei minh 'nu bơngai măt tol. Sư arih kơ chă apinh sa tơmam đe. Anăn sư 'Bartimê, kon Timê. Sư oei ngôi 'bơ̆t cheng trong.

English: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out and say, “Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!”
Bahnar: Lăp sư kơtơ̆ng đe khan Yêsu đơ̆ng Pơlei Nasaret wă yak trong sư na sư krao 'bơ̆r re khan: “Ơ Yêsu, ơ 'Bok Krist Kon Sâu pơtao Đawit, apinh Ih mơnat kơ inh 'biơ̆ bĕ.”

English: Then many warned him to be quiet; but he cried out all the more, “Son of David, have mercy on me!”
Bahnar: Đei lơ bơngai khă sư 'nĕ pă krao, mă-lei sư rai krao 'bơ̆r re: “Ơ Kon Sâu pơtao Đawit, apinh Ih mơnat kơ inh 'biơ̆ bĕ.”

English: So Jesus stood still and commanded him to be called. Then they called the blind man, saying to him, “Be of good cheer. Rise, He is calling you.”
Bahnar: Na Yêsu dơ̆ng păng khan: “Krao sư tơ âu.” Đe năm krao bơngai măt tol ei khan: “Ih 'nĕ pă sơ'ngon. Iung bĕ, Yêsu krao ih tơ to.”

English: And throwing aside his garment, he rose and came to Jesus.
Bahnar: Bơngai tol ei plôh lê̆ ao tơnŏ sư gruih iung năm tơ Yêsu.

English: So Jesus answered and said to him, “What do you want Me to do for you?” The blind man said to Him, “Rabboni, that I may receive my sight.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Ih wă kơ Inh pơm kiơ?” Bơngai măt tol ei khan: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, inh wă kơ Ih pơklaih măt inh gơh 'bôh hơdah.”

English: Then Jesus said to him, “Go your way; your faith has made you well.” And immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus on the road.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư dơ̆ng: “Yak kơ ih bĕ, yua kơ ih lui na măt ih klaih.” 'Bơ̆t ei măt sư 'bôh hơdah na sư kiơ̆ hloi Yêsu.

English: Now when they drew near Jerusalem, to Bethphage and Bethany, at the Mount of Olives, He sent two of His disciples
Bahnar: Lu sư wă jê̆ truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem boih, truh 'bơ̆t Pơlei Betphagê păng Pơlei Bethani kơpal kông Ôliwơ. 'Bơ̆t ei Yêsu wơh 'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan

English: and He said to them, “Go into the village opposite you; and as soon as you have entered it you will find a colt tied, on which no one has sat. Loose it and bring it.
Bahnar: “Biĕm mơ̆t tơ pơlei tơpăt anăp biĕm to. Lăp biĕm truh tơ noh biĕm 'bôh minh pôm aseh iĕ đe chô̆ 'bơ̆t noh. Aseh iĕ noh ưh tam đei bu hao ôh đơ̆ng sơ̆. Biĕm yaih dui anhăk aseh iĕ noh tơ âu.

English: And if anyone says to you, ‘Why are you doing this?’ say, ‘The Lord has need of it,’ and immediately he will send it here.”
Bahnar: Dah đe khan: ‘Biĕm iŏk pơm kiơ?’ Biĕm khan kơ sư thoi âu: ‘Kră Yang wă yua 'biơ̆, kơnh Sư tơwih tơ âu dơ̆ng.’ ”

English: So they went their way, and found the colt tied by the door outside on the street, and they loosed it.
Bahnar: Bre sư năm tơ ei, lăp truh na 'bôh tơpă aseh iĕ dăm noh, oei chô̆ 'bơ̆t 'măng hnam. Aseh iĕ noh dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t trong na bre sư yaih iŏk.

English: But some of those who stood there said to them, “What are you doing, loosing the colt?”
Bahnar: Đei 'bar pêng 'nu bơngai oei kiơ̆ ei na khan kơ bre sư: “Biĕm iŏk pơm kiơ kơ aseh iĕ noh?”

English: And they spoke to them just as Jesus had commanded. So they let them go.
Bahnar: Bre sư khan kơ lu đe ei thoi Yêsu pơkă kơ bre sư hei. Na lu tơmoi ei ăn kơ bre sư iŏk.

English: Then they brought the colt to Jesus and threw their clothes on it, and He sat on it.
Bahnar: Bre sư dui anhăk aseh iĕ noh tơ Yêsu. Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư lơ̆k ao lu sư kơdih kơpal rŏng aseh iĕ ei, na Yêsu hao.

English: And many spread their clothes on the road, and others cut down leafy branches from the trees and spread them on the road.
Bahnar: Đei lơ bơngai nai lơ̆k ao lu sư kơdih kiơ̆ trong wă kơ 'lơ̆ng rŏ. Đei lu mơ'nah koh hơmŭl 'long đơ̆ng jih mir lơ̆k săp kơpal trong mơ̆n.

English: Then those who went before and those who followed cried out, saying: “Hosanna! ‘Blessed is He who comes in the name of the LORD!’
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă yak hơdrol kơ Yêsu păng lu bơngai yak đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Sư chhôk na pơma re 'bơ̆r khan: “Hôsana, bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Bơnê kơ Yêsu truh tơ âu yua kơ Kră Yang wơh.

English: Blessed is the kingdom of our father David That comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!”
Bahnar: Bơnê kơ Yêsu truh tơ âu Sư wă pơgơ̆r thoi 'bok bơ̆n Đawit sơ̆, păng bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kơpal plĕnh ti.”

English: And Jesus went into Jerusalem and into the temple. So when He had looked around at all things, as the hour was already late, He went out to Bethany with the twelve.
Bahnar: Yêsu mơ̆t lăm Pơlei Jêrusalem boih, na Sư mơ̆t tơ lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm. Sư chă lăng lăm hnam akŭm ei jơ̆p boih, na Sư păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư wih tơ Pơlei Bethani kơlih kơ 'năr kơsơ̆ boih.

English: Now the next day, when they had come out from Bethany, He was hungry.
Bahnar: Lăp pơgê dơning dơ̆ng lu sư yak đơ̆ng Pơlei Bethani năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem na Yêsu pơngot.

English: And seeing from afar a fig tree having leaves, He went to see if perhaps He would find something on it. When He came to it, He found nothing but leaves, for it was not the season for figs.
Bahnar: Sư tơmang 'bôh minh tơnơm 'long hơra đơ̆ng ataih đei hla. Na Sư năm lăng 'long hơra noh ngêh kơ đei plei tă kơ ưh, 'bôh pôm hla hoh kơlih kơ tam mă trŏ bơyan hơra plei.

English: In response Jesus said to it, “Let no one eat fruit from you ever again.” And His disciples heard it.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu sơkat kơ tơnơm 'long hơra 'noh khan: “Đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp e 'nĕ pă plei dơ̆ng. Lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư kơtơ̆ng mơ̆n sư sơkat kơ 'long hơra.”

English: So they came to Jerusalem. Then Jesus went into the temple and began to drive out those who bought and sold in the temple, and overturned the tables of the money changers and the seats of those who sold doves.
Bahnar: Lu sư truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Na Yêsu mơ̆t dơ̆ng tơ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm. Sư pơpuh đe mơdro lăm hnam 'noh. Sư tơlơ̆ tơpơ̆k lu gơ'bang lu đe tơplih băl jên. Lu tang-dŏ lu đe mă tĕch sem kơtơp Sư tơlơ̆ tơpơ̆k đĭ-đăng.

English: And He would not allow anyone to carry wares through the temple.
Bahnar: Păng Sư kư̆m khă đe ưh kơ ăn chĕp mă tơmam kiơ kiơ brih nhah rok trong cham hnam akŭm ei.

English: Then He taught, saying to them, “Is it not written, ‘My house shall be called a house of prayer for all nations’? But you have made it a ‘den of thieves.’”
Bahnar: Na Sư bơtho khan kơ lu bơngai ei thoi âu: “Đe chih roi nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Sư thoi âu: ‘Hnam akŭm kơkuh kơ Inh wă lê̆ kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak akŭm krao khan lăm noh.’ Mă-lei iĕm mơdro lăm noh, pơgŏ athei đe răt kăp jên, iĕm pơm kơ hnam akŭm âu thoi lĕ kơ anih hnam đe tơtông klĕ.”

English: And the scribes and chief priests heard it and sought how they might destroy Him; for they feared Him, because all the people were astonished at His teaching.
Bahnar: Lu 'bok soi tih păng lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê kơtơ̆ng tơdrong 'noh, na lu sư chă tơdrong wă rôp pơlôch Sư. Lu sư hli kơ Yêsu kơlih kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai 'maih mơ̆ng tơdrong Sư bơtho, yua kơ lu sư mơ̆ng hlĭch tơpă.

English: When evening had come, He went out of the city.
Bahnar: 'Năr kơsơ̆ boih na lu đe Yêsu lĕch đơ̆ng Pơlei Jêrusalem.

English: Now in the morning, as they passed by, they saw the fig tree dried up from the roots.
Bahnar: Lăp pơgê năr đơ̆ng rŏng dơ̆ng lu sư yak rok trong lu sư krô đêl năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, lu sư 'bôh tơm 'long hơra đĭ kro boih.

English: And Peter, remembering, said to Him, “Rabbi, look! The fig tree which You cursed has withered away.”
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs 'blŏk kơ tơdrong 'noh na sư khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, Ih lăng tơm 'long hơra đêl Ih sơkat brei kro lôch boih.”

English: So Jesus answered and said to them, “Have faith in God.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Kơlih kơ thoi noh na bơ̆n athei lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mă kơjăp.

English: For assuredly, I say to you, whoever says to this mountain, ‘Be removed and be cast into the sea,’ and does not doubt in his heart, but believes that those things he says will be done, he will have whatever he says.
Bahnar: Inh roi kơ iĕm tơpăt, dah bơ̆n wă sơkat kơ kông âu gơh mơ̆n. Bơ̆n khan thoi âu: ‘Weh bĕ e, hiŏng kơtah kơdih tơ đak dơsĭ to.’ Dah bơ̆n lui kơ kông âu gô hiŏng kơtah kơdih tơpă 'nĕ kơ ngĭl ngŭl, lei bơ̆n gô 'bôh tơpă.

English: Therefore I say to you, whatever things you ask when you pray, believe that you receive them, and you will have them.
Bahnar: Kơlih kơ thoi noh na Inh khan kơ iĕm, mă tơdrong kiơ kiơ iĕm krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei dah iĕm lui tơpă kơ Sư gô ăn tơdrong iĕm apinh 'noh, lei iĕm gô đei tơpă.

English: “And whenever you stand praying, if you have anything against anyone, forgive him, that your Father in heaven may also forgive you your trespasses.
Bahnar: Kơplah iĕm krao khan, iĕm 'nĕ kơ jô̆ yo mă iĕm đei tơdrong ơh păng bu bu ră, na mă 'Bă tơm bơ̆n kơpal plĕnh ti huay kơ jô̆ yo tôm tơdrong yoch iĕm.

English: But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father in heaven forgive your trespasses.”
Bahnar: Dah iĕm oei jô̆ yo kơ đe pơm yoch kơ iĕm, lei 'Bă tơm bơ̆n kơpal plĕnh ti kư̆m jô̆ yo kơ tơdrong yoch iĕm mơ̆n.”

English: Then they came again to Jerusalem. And as He was walking in the temple, the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders came to Him.
Bahnar: Lăp lu sư truh tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, Yêsu chă nơnăm lăm hnam akŭm tơm, na lu 'bok soi tih, lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê, hăm lu kră sek tơlang năm tơ Sư.

English: And they said to Him, “By what authority are You doing these things? And who gave You this authority to do these things?”
Bahnar: Lu sư jet Yêsu: “Bu ăn kơ Ih pơpuh đe mơdro đơ̆ng hnam akŭm âu păng chă bơtho đe lăm hnam akŭm âu mơ̆n?”

English: But Jesus answered and said to them, “I also will ask you one question; then answer Me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Lei Inh kư̆m wă jet iĕm minh tơdrong mơ̆n. Dah iĕm tơl Inh, lei Inh kư̆m tơl tơwih kơ iĕm băt bu ăn kơ Inh pơpuh đe păng bơtho đe tơ lăm hnam akŭm.

English: The baptism of John—was it from heaven or from men? Answer Me.”
Bahnar: Bĭ tơdrong Yôhan pơm kơ đe 'batem noh sơ̆ đơ̆ng bu ăn, đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei dah đơ̆ng kon bơngai? Iĕm tơl lăng Inh wăi.”

English: And they reasoned among themselves, saying, “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ He will say, ‘Why then did you not believe him?’
Bahnar: Lu sư pơđâu băl khan: “Bơ̆n wă khan kơ Sư thoi yơ? Dah bơ̆n khan đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei lei Sư khan: ‘Iĕm kuă kơ kiơ lui kơ Yôhan bơtho?’

English: But if we say, ‘From men’ ”—they feared the people, for all counted John to have been a prophet indeed.
Bahnar: Na dang ei bơ̆n hăm wă khan đơ̆ng kon bơngai?” Mă-lei lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ wă khan đơ̆ng kon bơngai mơ̆n yua kơ lu sư hli kơ kon pơlei pơla, yua kơ đĭ-đăng lu kon pơlei pơla lu sư khan băt kơ Yôhan bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: So they answered and said to Jesus, “We do not know.” And Jesus answered and said to them, “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na lu sư khan: “Nhôn ưh kơ băt ôh.” Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Lei Inh kư̆m ưh kơ roi ăn kơ iĕm bu ăn kơ Inh pơpuh đe păng bơtho đe tơ lăm hnam akŭm âu mơ̆n.”

English: Then He began to speak to them in parables: “A man planted a vineyard and set a hedge around it, dug a place for the wine vat and built a tower. And he leased it to vinedressers and went into a far country.
Bahnar: 'Blă kơ noh Yêsu bơtho pơtih gia kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Đei minh 'nu bơngai pơm mir wă pơtăm 'long hơmu. Sư war dur tăp dăr boih, lăm mir noh sư pơm minh pôm tơpăl tơmo wă peh plei hơmu chơpĕt iŏk đak sư. Păng sư pơm minh pôm hnam tông wă gak plei hơmu. Sư pơm tôm tơdrong noh boih na sư ăn kơ đe jang mơng, tơ'ngla sư năm oei tơ dêh nai.

English: Now at vintage-time he sent a servant to the vinedressers, that he might receive some of the fruit of the vineyard from the vinedressers.
Bahnar: Lăp trŏ kơ bơyan plei hơmu đum boih, na sư wơh minh 'nu đĭch sư năm tơ lu bơngai jang mơng mir hơmu noh wă chĕng iŏk minh pah mir hơmu.

English: And they took him and beat him and sent him away empty-handed.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai jang mơng mir hơmu noh rôp tôn teh tơbrŏk sư hoh hoh đĕch.

English: Again he sent them another servant, and at him they threw stones, wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully treated.
Bahnar: Na 'bok tơ'ngla mir noh wơh dơ̆ng minh 'nu đĭch sư, mă-lei lu bơngai jang mơng mir hơmu noh pơma kơnê̆ kơ sư, tôn teh kơ̆l sư.

English: And again he sent another, and him they killed; and many others, beating some and killing some.
Bahnar: 'Bok tơ'ngla mir hơmu noh wơh dơ̆ng minh 'nu. Lu bơngai jang mơng ei pơlôch hloi. 'Bok tơ'ngla mir noh sư kư̆m wơh lơ dơ̆ng ră, mă-lei mơ'nah lu sư teh pơjĭ, mơ'nah lu sư pơlôch.

English: Therefore still having one son, his beloved, he also sent him to them last, saying, ‘They will respect my son.’
Bahnar: 'Bok tơ'ngla mir hơmu noh sư oei đei pă minh 'nu bơngai, kon pôm sư 'mêm kơdih ră. Tơpo hơtuch sư wơh kon sư năm tơ lu đe ei. Sư chă pơma khan: ‘Lu đe noh gô chu yom kơ kon inh thâu.’

English: But those vinedressers said among themselves, ‘This is the heir. Come, let us kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.’
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu bơngai jang mơng mir hơmu noh pơđâu dih băl khan: ‘Bơngai 'noh boih kon 'bok tơ'ngla mir âu, na dang ei bĕ bơ̆n pơlôch sư na mă mir âu jing mir bơ̆n.’

English: So they took him and killed him and cast him out of the vineyard.
Bahnar: Lu sư rôp hloi kon 'bok tơ'ngla mir ei, pơlôch hŭt akâu sư tơ jih mir.

English: “Therefore what will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the vinedressers, and give the vineyard to others.
Bahnar: “Thoi noh boih na 'bok tơ'ngla mir gô pơm kiơ kơ lu bơngai noh? Sư gô năm pơlôch pơđĭ lu bơngai noh, na sư pơjao ăn kơ lu bơngai nai jang dơ̆ng.

English: Have you not even read this Scripture: ‘The stone which the builders rejected Has become the chief cornerstone.
Bahnar: Mă tơdrong 'noh kư̆m thoi iĕm đŏk boih đe chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi âu: ‘Tơmo lu bơngai man hnam tŭk boih, tơmo noh 'Bok Kei-Dei lăng gĭt tơpă man pơklop sư 'bơ̆t mum hnam.

English: This was the LORD’s doing, And it is marvelous in our eyes’?”
Bahnar: Sư pơm thoi noh trŏ tơpă mă măt bơ̆n lăng kư̆m 'lơ̆ng mơ̆n.’ ”

English: And they sought to lay hands on Him, but feared the multitude, for they knew He had spoken the parable against them. So they left Him and went away.
Bahnar: Na lu 'bok soi tih, lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê, hăm lu đe kră sek tơlang chă tơdrong wă rôp hloi Yêsu yua kơ lu sư băt dôm tơdrong Yêsu pơma pơjuang noh hei trŏ hloi kơ lu sư tơpă. Mă-lei lu sư hli kơ lu kon pơlei pơla 'bơ̆t ei, na lu sư weh đơ̆ng Yêsu 'noh năm tơ nai.

English: Then they sent to Him some of the Pharisees and the Herodians, to catch Him in His words.
Bahnar: Lu sư athei 'bar pêng 'nu bơngai khŭl Pharisi păng 'bar pêng 'nu bơngai khŭl pơtao Hêrôt năm tơ Yêsu wă chă tơdrong gơh rôp Sư dah Sư pơma khă gah tơdrong ăn jên thuê̆.

English: When they had come, they said to Him, “Teacher, we know that You are true, and care about no one; for You do not regard the person of men, but teach the way of God in truth. Is it lawful to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?
Bahnar: Lu sư roi kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, nhôn băt kơ Ih bơngai tơpăt, Ih ưh kơ hli kơ bu ôh. Ih lăng lu bơngai pơm tih, lu bơngai iĕ lei-lăi ngăl păng bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpăt ling-lang. Na nhôn apinh Ih khan kơ nhôn, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong juăt bơ̆n bơngai Juđê, bơ̆n hăm gơh ăn jên thuê̆ kơ Sêsar pơtao đe Rôm dah ưh?”

English: Shall we pay, or shall we not pay?” But He, knowing their hypocrisy, said to them, “Why do you test Me? Bring Me a denarius that I may see it.”
Bahnar: Bơ̆n wă chu ăn dah ưh? Lu sư pơma thoi noh, Yêsu băt kơ lu sư wă plơ̆ plĕch kơ Sư na Sư khan kơ lu sư: “Yua kơ kiơ iĕm wă jet pơlong lăng Inh? Iĕm ăn kơ Inh minh hlak jên iĕm tơ âu wă kơ Inh lăng.”

English: So they brought it. And He said to them, “Whose image and inscription is this?” They said to Him, “Caesar’s.”
Bahnar: Lu sư ăn kơ Sư lăng minh hlak jên na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Rup bu âu? Anăn bu âu?” Lu sư khan: “'Noh rup Sêsar păng anăn Sêsar mơ̆n.”

English: And Jesus answered and said to them, “Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s, and to God the things that are God’s.” And they marveled at Him.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Yêsu khan: “Jên âu rup Sêsar tơpă, na bơ̆n athei thuê̆ kơ sư yua kơ sư pơgơ̆r. Tơmam 'Bok Kei-Dei bơ̆n athei pơyơ̆r kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei yua kơ Sư tơgŭm ăn kơ bơ̆n.” Lu sư mơ̆ng Yêsu tơl lu sư trŏ tơpă.

English: Then some Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to Him; and they asked Him, saying
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Juđê mơ'nah lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong Sađusê. Lu sư khan kon bơngai lôch ưh kơ iung arih dơ̆ng ôh. Lu sư mơ'nah năm pơjah pơjăng păng Yêsu na lu sư jet Yêsu thoi âu

English: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if a man’s brother dies, and leaves his wife behind, and leaves no children, his brother should take his wife and raise up offspring for his brother.
Bahnar: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, tơdrong juăt Môis chih ată kơ bơ̆n sơ̆ thoi âu: ‘'Nhŏng bu lôch, mi sư adro ưh kơ đei kon, oh sư athei iŏk mi sư pơm akăn na pơjing kon kơ 'nhŏng sư.’

English: Now there were seven brothers. The first took a wife; and dying, he left no offspring.
Bahnar: Na sơ̆ đei minh pôm hnam dơnŏ đei tơpơh 'nu 'nhŏng oh. 'Nhŏng kơdră lu sư iŏk akăn. Lăp 'nhŏng lu sư lôch ưh tam mă đei kon

English: And the second took her, and he died; nor did he leave any offspring. And the third likewise.
Bahnar: na oh sư mă 'bar iŏk mi sư pơm akăn dơ̆ng, ưh tam mă đei kon kư̆m lôch. Oh sư mă pêng iŏk mi sư pơm akăn dơ̆ng ưh kơ đei kon kư̆m lôch.

English: So the seven had her and left no offspring. Last of all the woman died also.
Bahnar: Tơpơh 'nu 'nhŏng oh sư noh iŏk minh 'nu akăn. Tơpo hơtuch akăn lu sư noh kư̆m lôch kiơ̆ lu sư mơ̆n.

English: Therefore, in the resurrection, when they rise, whose wife will she be? For all seven had her as wife.”
Bahnar: Ih khan kon bơngai gô iung arih, na mưh lu sư iung arih đơ̆ng lôch ning-mônh, akăn lu sư noh jing akăn bu kơ lu sư mă tơpă, yua kơ tơpơh 'nu drŏ-nglo iŏk minh 'nu drŏ-kăn?”

English: Jesus answered and said to them, “Are you not therefore mistaken, because you do not know the Scriptures nor the power of God?
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong noh yua kơ iĕm ưh kơ pơwao sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei, na iĕm ưh kơ băt Sư gơh pơm tôm tơdrong.

English: For when they rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven.
Bahnar: Ning-mônh đĭ-đăng kon bơngai iung arih đơ̆ng lôch, đe ưh pă đei tơiŏk băl klo kăn dơ̆ng ôh, lu sư thoi lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ plĕnh ti.

English: But concerning the dead, that they rise, have you not read in the book of Moses, in the burning bush passage, how God spoke to him, saying, ‘I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob’?
Bahnar: Tơdrong kon bơngai iung arih đơ̆ng lôch, iĕm kư̆m đŏk lăng boih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong juăt Môis chih, sư roi tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma kơ sư tơ tơm 'long ŭnh sa. 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ sư: ‘Inh boih Kră Yang Abraham, Kră Yang wei-lăng Isăk, Kră Yang wei-lăng Jakôp.’ ”

English: He is not the God of the dead, but the God of the living. You are therefore greatly mistaken.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng: “Lu bơngai âu lôch đĭ boih kơplah noh sơ̆, mă-lei lu sư gô iung arih đĭ tôm lu sư yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang wei-lăng gah tơdrong arih, ưh kơ sĭ Sư wei-lăng gah tơdrong lôch ôh. Lu iĕm ưh kơ hlôh ôh.”

English: Then one of the scribes came, and having heard them reasoning together, perceiving that He had answered them well, asked Him, “Which is the first commandment of all?”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh đei minh 'nu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê năm tơ lu sư. 'Bok thây ei kơtơ̆ng lu sư pơjah pơjăng dih băl, sư băt Yêsu tơl trŏ, na sư jet Yêsu: “Dôm tơdrong juăt 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, tơdrong juăt ayơ kăl hloh?”

English: Jesus answered him, “The first of all the commandments is: ‘Hear, O Israel, the LORD our God, the LORD is one.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư thoi âu: “Đĭ-đăng tơdrong juăt, tơdrong juăt âu kăl hloh: ‘Ơ bơngai Isơrael, pôm Kră Yang bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch Kră Yang tih hloh.

English: And you shall love the LORD your God with all your heart, with all your soul, with all your mind, and with all your strength.’ This is the first commandment.
Bahnar: Bơ̆n athei 'mêm kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang bơ̆n hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak bơ̆n păng đĭ dôm tơdrong đon bơ̆n tơchĕng.’

English: And the second, like it, is this: ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself.’ There is no other commandment greater than these.”
Bahnar: Na tơdrong juăt mă 'bar thoi âu: ‘Bơ̆n athei 'mêm kơ bôl buăl thoi bơ̆n 'mêm akâu kơdih.’ Ưh kơ đei tơdrong juăt ayơ mă kăl hloh kơ 'bar tơdrong juăt âu.”

English: So the scribe said to Him, “Well said, Teacher. You have spoken the truth, for there is one God, and there is no other but He.
Bahnar: 'Bok thây ei khan kơ Yêsu: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, Ih roi kơ nhôn tơdrong juăt âu trŏ boih. Ih roi trŏ tơpă Ih khan 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch Kră Yang tih hloh ưh kơ đei yang nai tih hloh kơ Sư.

English: And to love Him with all the heart, with all the understanding, with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love one’s neighbor as oneself, is more than all the whole burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
Bahnar: Dah bơ̆n 'mêm kơ Sư hăm đĭ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak bơ̆n, hăm đĭ đon bơ̆n tơchĕng păng băt 'mêm kơ bôl buăl thoi bơ̆n 'mêm akâu kơdih, dah bơ̆n răk 'bar tơdrong juăt 'noh lei 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ đĭ-đăng tơdrong bơ̆n soi sơmah kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: Now when Jesus saw that he answered wisely, He said to him, “You are not far from the kingdom of God.” But after that no one dared question Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu 'bôh 'bok thây noh tơl hơgei na Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Ih wă jê̆ pơyơ̆r akâu ih kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei boih.” Klaih kơ noh ưh kơ đei bu pơ̆n jet Yêsu dơ̆ng.

English: Then Jesus answered and said, while He taught in the temple, “How is it that the scribes say that the Christ is the Son of David?
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei bơtho lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm Sư khan: “Liơ lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê khan 'Bok Krist mă 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh pơm Pơtao, Sư kon sâu pơtao Đawit đĕch?

English: For David himself said by the Holy Spirit: ‘The LORD said to my Lord, “Sit at My right hand, Till I make Your enemies Your footstool.” ’
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng athei Đawit khan thoi âu: ‘Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ Yŏng Kơdră inh thoi âu: Ih kư̆ kơ oei gah 'ma kơ Inh pơgơ̆r tơ̆p Inh blah rôp lu bơngai mă ayăt kơ Ih thuơ tơ kơnơl jơ̆ng Ih.’

English: Therefore David himself calls Him ‘Lord’; how is He then his Son?” And the common people heard Him gladly.
Bahnar: Đawit krao kơ 'Bok Krist Yŏng Kơdră sư, na lơliơ dang ei khan 'Bok Krist jing kon sâu Đawit lĕ?” Lu bơngai tơpôl mơ̆ng kiơ̆ ei lăp đon tơpă tôm tơdrong Sư bơtho.

English: Then He said to them in His teaching, “Beware of the scribes, who desire to go around in long robes, love greetings in the marketplaces
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei bơtho lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, Sư khan: “Iĕm athei kơchăng kơ lu 'bok thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê. Lu sư lăp đon kơ hrŭk ao tai wă kơ pơrŏ na chă ngôi. Păng lu sư lăp đon wă kơ đe kơkuh kơ sư tơ kơchơ.

English: the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts
Bahnar: Lu sư lăp đon kơ oei tang-dŏ 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ bôl buăl lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei păng lăm năr et sa tih.

English: who devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers. These will receive greater condemnation.”
Bahnar: Lu sư chă pơjĭp iŏk mŭk tơmam lu drŏ-kăn adro, na lu sư kư̆m pơm pơrŏ krao khan kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đunh wă kơ đe jô̆ kơ sư khan bơngai 'lơ̆ng. Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei gô phak lu sư hloh kơ đe ning-mônh.”

English: Now Jesus sat opposite the treasury and saw how the people put money into the treasury. And many who were rich put in much.
Bahnar: Yêsu oei jê̆ kơthŭng tah jên pơyơ̆r lăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm. Sư lăng đe tah jên lăm noh. Đei lơ bơngai mơdrŏng tah jên lơ.

English: Then one poor widow came and threw in two mites, which make a quadrans.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu yă adro dơnuh năm tơ noh tah lăp 'bar hlak jên ngang.

English: So He called His disciples to Himself and said to them, “Assuredly, I say to you that this poor widow has put in more than all those who have given to the treasury
Bahnar: Na Yêsu krao lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư păng khan: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, yă adro dơnuh âu tah lơ hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu bôl nai

English: for they all put in out of their abundance, but she out of her poverty put in all that she had, her whole livelihood.”
Bahnar: kơlih kơ lu bôl nai pơyơ̆r tơmam rơkah sư đĕch; yă adro âu dơnuh tơpă mă-lei sư pơyơ̆r đĭ hloi jên sa sư.”

English: Then as He went out of the temple, one of His disciples said to Him, “Teacher, see what manner of stones and what buildings are here!”
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu lĕch đơ̆ng hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm, đei minh 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư khan kơ Sư: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, Ih lăng deh, hnam âu đe pơm păng tơmo rŏ dêh iih?”

English: And Jesus answered and said to him, “Do you see these great buildings? Not one stone shall be left upon another, that shall not be thrown down.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Ih 'bôh boih hnam akŭm tih âu, mă-lei ning-mônh hnam âu gô pơchah reng 'beng ưh pă đei tơmo ayơ tơklep băl dơ̆ng. Đe gô teh pơchah đĭ.”

English: Now as He sat on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John, and Andrew asked Him privately
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh Yêsu năm ngôi tơ kông Ôliwơ pah to thong đơ̆ng hnam akŭm tơm ei. Na Pêtrôs, Yakơ, Yôhan, Andrê, lu sư jet Yêsu kơdrô̆ lu sư khan

English: “Tell us, when will these things be? And what will be the sign when all these things will be fulfilled?”
Bahnar: “Apinh Ih roi kơ nhôn layơ đe wă pơrăm hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei to păng wă kơ nhôn băt tơdra liơ tơdrong noh gô truh.”

English: And Jesus, answering them, began to say: “Take heed that no one deceives you.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Iĕm athei kơchăng kơdih hli kơ đe wă pơhlŭ pơlung iĕm kiơ̆ sư.

English: For many will come in My name, saying, ‘I am He,’ and will deceive many.
Bahnar: Ning-mônh gô đei lơ bơngai truh sư anăn măt Inh khan sư kơdih 'Bok Krist. Kư̆m đei lơ bơngai lui kơ sư pơhlŭ.

English: But when you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be troubled; for such things must happen, but the end is not yet.
Bahnar: Păng iĕm kơtơ̆ng đe tơblah mă jê̆ mă ataih, iĕm 'nĕ kơ hli hŏ. Tơdrong 'noh ưh kơ jor ôh, gô đei 'mơ̆i, mă-lei năr tôch ưh tam mă truh ôh kơplah noh.

English: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. And there will be earthquakes in various places, and there will be famines and troubles. These are the beginnings of sorrows.
Bahnar: Đei dêh âu iung blah dêh to, dêh to iung blah dêh nai. Gô đei teh adrŏ lơ anih tơ âu tơ to. Păng đei tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt. Mă-lei kơplah noh tơdrong gleh truh 'nao wă pơtơm đĕch.

English: “But watch out for yourselves, for they will deliver you up to councils, and you will be beaten in the synagogues. You will be brought before rulers and kings for My sake, for a testimony to them.
Bahnar: “Păng iĕm athei kơchăng kơdih yua kơ đe gô rôp iĕm jao kơ lu kră sek tơlang. Đe gô tôn teh iĕm tơ lăm hnam akŭm đe Juđê. Đe kư̆m gô anhăk iĕm dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp lu 'bok tih hăm lu 'bok pơtao yua kơ iĕm lui kơ Inh, na iĕm kư̆m gơh ră roi kơ lu sư băt kơ inh.

English: And the gospel must first be preached to all the nations.
Bahnar: Gô lu bơngai lui kơ Inh bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak 'mơ̆i na truh năr tôch.

English: But when they arrest you and deliver you up, do not worry beforehand, or premeditate what you will speak. But whatever is given you in that hour, speak that; for it is not you who speak, but the Holy Spirit.
Bahnar: Mưh đe rôp iĕm, jao iĕm kơ lu kră sek tơlang, iĕm 'nĕ mah tơchĕng hơdrol kơ tơdrong iĕm wă pơma kơ lu sư noh hŏ, yua kơ đei Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơgŭm iĕm kơplah lăm iĕm wă pơma, ưh kơ sĭ kơ iĕm gơh pơma kơdih ôh.

English: Now brother will betray brother to death, and a father his child; and children will rise up against parents and cause them to be put to death.
Bahnar: Kư̆m gô đei 'nhŏng jao oh sư bơngai lui tơ̆p mă đe pơlôch. Kư̆m đei mơ'nah 'bă sư jao kon sư tơ̆p mă đe pơlôch. Kư̆m đei mơ'nah kon sư hil plơ̆ kơ mĕ 'bă sư jao bre sư ăn kơ đe pơlôch.

English: And you will be hated by all for My name’s sake. But he who endures to the end shall be saved.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kơ bơngai gô areh arĕnh kơ iĕm yua kơ iĕm lui kơ Inh. Thoi noh bơngai bu adrin lui kơ Inh truh năr tôch, bơngai 'noh gô klaih.

English: “So when you see the ‘abomination of desolation,’ spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not” (let the reader understand), “then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.
Bahnar: “Ning-mônh iĕm gô 'bôh lu bơngai kơnê̆ wă pơrăm kon bơngai gô truh, lu sư oei tơ anih đe kơ̆m kơ oei. Na bu đŏk lăng hla bơar âu đon sư athei pơwao kơdih. Lu iĕm bơngai mă oei tơ dêh Juđê 'bôh thoi noh iĕm athei jăk tơ kông ataih đơ̆ng lu sư hloi.

English: Let him who is on the housetop not go down into the house, nor enter to take anything out of his house.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ngôi tơ 'ngoaih hnam, 'nĕ pă mơ̆t iŏk tơmam sư tơ hnam dơ̆ng.

English: And let him who is in the field not go back to get his clothes.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu oei jang tơ mir, 'nĕ pă brŏk iŏk ao tơnŏ sư tơ hnam.

English: But woe to those who are pregnant and to those who are nursing babies in those days!
Bahnar: Kơplah ei kơnh, lu bơngai drŏ-kăn akâu kơhioh păng lu bơngai drŏ-kăn tơmŏm kon, lu sư pơmat-tat dêh.

English: And pray that your flight may not be in winter.
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm athei krao khan apinh 'Bok Kei-Dei 'nĕ ăn tơdrong noh truh kơplah bơyan 'mi hngach

English: For in those days there will be tribulation, such as has not been since the beginning of the creation which God created until this time, nor ever shall be.
Bahnar: yua kơ kơplah ei kơnh gô đei tơdrong tơblah tih hloh kơ đơ̆ng năr 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing plĕnh teh sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei. Mă-lei đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh kư̆m huay kơ mah dang noh mơ̆n.

English: And unless the Lord had shortened those days, no flesh would be saved; but for the elect’s sake, whom He chose, He shortened the days.
Bahnar: Dah 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ achơ̆t lê̆ tơdrong tơblah tih noh, ưh kơ đei bu arih ôh. Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei achơ̆t lê̆, yua kơ Sư mơnat kơ lu bơngai mă Sư rơih boih.

English: “Then if anyone says to you, ‘Look, here is the Christ!’ or, ‘Look, He is there!’ do not believe it.
Bahnar: “Năr noh dah đe khan kơ iĕm 'Bok Krist tơ âu boih, 'Bok Krist tơ to boih, iĕm 'nĕ kơ lui hŏ

English: For false christs and false prophets will rise and show signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect.
Bahnar: yua kơ năr noh kơnh đei lơ bơngai pơm Krist, đei lơ bơngai khan sư bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei. Lu sư kư̆m gơh pơm tơdrong mơsêh wă kơ lu bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih boih lui kơ lu sư pơhlŭ ră.

English: But take heed; see, I have told you all things beforehand.
Bahnar: Mă-lei iĕm athei kơchăng kơdih, yua kơ Inh roi kơ iĕm tôm tơdrong hơdrol boih.

English: “But in those days, after that tribulation, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light
Bahnar: “Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ tơdrong anat noh boih măt 'năr gô măng mu, măt khei ưh kơ hơdah.

English: the stars of heaven will fall, and the powers in the heavens will be shaken.
Bahnar: Sơnglŏng gô huŏng đơ̆ng plĕnh yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei gơgŭ.

English: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in the clouds with great power and glory.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh đe gô 'bôh Inh Kon Bơngai 'lơ̆ng rŏ mơsêh mơyang tih-tin jur hăm hơmơ̆l.

English: And then He will send His angels, and gather together His elect from the four winds, from the farthest part of earth to the farthest part of heaven.
Bahnar: Na Inh wơh lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng Inh jur năm jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak wă krao anhăk đĭ-đăng lu khŭl bơngai mă Inh rơih iŏk, đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch truh gah bơmơ̆t, đơ̆ng gah yă-nơ̆m truh gah gơal, akŭm đĭ tơ Inh.

English: “Now learn this parable from the fig tree: When its branch has already become tender, and puts forth leaves, you know that summer is near.
Bahnar: “Na dang ei iĕm mơ̆ng pơtih gia kơ 'long hơra. Lăp iĕm 'bôh dơng sư hơđoh chăt hla, noh iĕm băt kơ wă jê̆ bơyan 'mi boih.

English: So you also, when you see these things happening, know that it is near—at the doors!
Bahnar: Na dôm tơdrong Inh roi kơ iĕm noh hei kư̆m lei-lăi. Ning-mônh lăp iĕm 'bôh dôm tơdrong Inh roi noh, iĕm băt Inh Kon Bơngai wă jê̆ jur boih. 'Noh dang lĕ kiơ̆ 'măng dur boih.

English: Assuredly, I say to you, this generation will by no means pass away till all these things take place.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, jơhnơr noh gô 'bôh tơpă tôm tơdrong Inh roi kơ iĕm noh hei.

English: Heaven and earth will pass away, but My words will by no means pass away.
Bahnar: Plĕnh teh gô hiong đĭ, mă-lei dôm tơdrong Inh pơma ưh kơ đei layơ hiong tôch ôh, gô 'bôh tơpă.

English: “But of that day and hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.
Bahnar: “Năr păng jơ ei ưh kơ đei bu băt. Lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh ti ưh kơ băt. Inh Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei ră, kư̆m hơdai ưh kơ băt mơ̆n. Pôm 'Bă Inh đĕch băt kơ năr ei kơnh.

English: Take heed, watch and pray; for you do not know when the time is.
Bahnar: Iĕm athei kơchăng tơdrong lui mă tơpă păng krao khan mă nŏng yua kơ iĕm ưh kơ băt tơdrong ei wă truh layơ.

English: It is like a man going to a far country, who left his house and gave authority to his servants, and to each his work, and commanded the doorkeeper to watch.
Bahnar: Tơdrong ei thoi lĕ kơ minh 'nu bơngai wă năm tơ dêh tơmoi ataih. Hơdrol kơ sư wă yak đơ̆ng hnam, sư pơkă kơ lu đĭch đam sư wei-lăng hnam păng rim 'nu lu sư jang kiơ̆ kơ tơ'ngla sư pơkă păng khan kơ bơngai gak 'măng athei kơchăng.

English: Watch therefore, for you do not know when the master of the house is coming—in the evening, at midnight, at the crowing of the rooster, or in the morning
Bahnar: Na iĕm athei kơchăng, kơlih kơ iĕm ưh kơ băt tơ'ngla hnam noh wă truh layơ: Til kơsơ̆, dah tŏk-bŏk măng, dah leng gong, dah 'năr lĕch.

English: lest, coming suddenly, he find you sleeping.
Bahnar: Na iĕm athei kơchăng mă tơpă hli kơ tơ'ngla hnam iĕm truh kơplah iĕm ưh kơ lêng ê kơplah iĕm oei tep.

English: And what I say to you, I say to all: Watch!”
Bahnar: Tơdrong Inh khan kơ iĕm âu, Inh khan kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai mơ̆n, ưh kơ sĭ kơdrô̆ iĕm ôh kơchăng.”

English: After two days it was the Passover and the Feast of Unleavened Bread. And the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take Him by trickery and put Him to death.
Bahnar: 'Bar năr hơdrol kơ Năr Giĕng Năm Brih păng giĕng sa 'Bĕng Mi Ưh Kơ Đei 'Buih Pông na lu 'bok soi tih hăm lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê, lu sư pơđâu chă tơdrong gơh rôp tơtông Yêsu na pơlôch.

English: But they said, “Not during the feast, lest there be an uproar of the people.”
Bahnar: Na lu sư khan: “Kơplah năr giĕng âu bơ̆n 'nĕ kơ pơm tơdrong noh, yua kơ năr giĕng âu kon tơring tơrang truh lơ, hli kơ lu sư blah bơ̆n.”

English: And being in Bethany at the house of Simon the leper, as He sat at the table, a woman came having an alabaster flask of very costly oil of spikenard. Then she broke the flask and poured it on His head.
Bahnar: Yêsu oei tơ hnam Simôn, bơngai mă jĭ chin, tơ Pơlei Bethani. Kơplah lu sư sŏng sa na đei minh 'nu drŏ-kăn năm tơ Sư chĕp minh pôm gŏl đak pơgang 'bâu phu đe gĭt tơpă. Gŏl noh đe pơm păng tơmo, na duch noh teh pơchah trơi gŏl ei na tuh đak pơgang 'bâu phu ei tơ kơ̆l Yêsu.

English: But there were some who were indignant among themselves, and said, “Why was this fragrant oil wasted?
Bahnar: Na đei 'bar pêng 'nu bơngai nai hil kơ drŏ-kăn noh na lu sư khan dih băl: “Lơliơ duch 'noh pơhuach kư̆ kă ưh kơ 'mêm kơ đak pơgang sư?

English: For it might have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and given to the poor.” And they criticized her sharply.
Bahnar: Đak pơgang 'bâu phu 'noh kăp pêng-hrĕng hlak jên hu. Lơliơ sư ưh kơ wă tĕch chă jên asong kơ lu bơngai dơnuh hin?” Lu sư hil ơh kơ duch 'noh bơbrơ̆k bơbrăk măk.

English: But Jesus said, “Let her alone. Why do you trouble her? She has done a good work for Me.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Lê̆ sư pơm thoi noh bưh, iĕm mah hil kiơ kơ sư? Sư pơm kơ Inh thoi noh trŏ boih.

English: For you have the poor with you always, and whenever you wish you may do them good; but Me you do not have always.
Bahnar: Bơngai dơnuh sư oei păng iĕm ling-lang. Dah iĕm wă mơnat kơ sư mă layơ kư̆m gơh, yua kơ Inh âu ưh kơ oei păng iĕm ling-lang ôh.

English: She has done what she could. She has come beforehand to anoint My body for burial.
Bahnar: Duch âu pơm tôch tơdrong sư 'mêm păng sư gơh pơm. Sư tuh đak pơgang 'bâu phu tơ akâu Inh hơdrol kơ đe wă 'bŭ Inh thoi đe juăt kơ pơm hơdrol kơ 'bŭ bơngai lôch.

English: Assuredly, I say to you, wherever this gospel is preached in the whole world, what this woman has done will also be told as a memorial to her.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, mă jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak lu bơngai bơtho tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng, lu sư kư̆m roi kơ đe tơdrong duch noh pơm kơ Inh wă kơ đe ư-ang kơ tơdrong sư pơm.”

English: Then Judas Iscariot, one of the twelve, went to the chief priests to betray Him to them.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh đei minh 'nu bơngai anăn sư Juđa Ikariôt, bơngai đơ̆ng mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu, năm tơ lu 'bok soi tih wă jao Yêsu kơ lu sư.

English: And when they heard it, they were glad, and promised to give him money. So he sought how he might conveniently betray Him.
Bahnar: Lăp lu 'bok soi tih kơtơ̆ng thoi noh, lu sư lăp đon tơpă mah pơkă khan wă apah kơ Juđa jên. Đơ̆ng noh na Juđa chă tơdrong wă plơ̆ plĕch Yêsu.

English: Now on the first day of Unleavened Bread, when they killed the Passover lamb, His disciples said to Him, “Where do You want us to go and prepare, that You may eat the Passover?”
Bahnar: Đe juăt kơ pơm giĕng sa 'Bĕng Mi Ưh Kơ Đei 'Buih Pông kơplah tơhngam năr. Na năr mă mônh lăm giĕng noh đe kư̆m juăt kơ 'bet sa triu kơ Năr Giĕng Năm Brih. Na trŏ kơ năr noh lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu jet Sư: “Ơ 'Bok Thây, Ih wă kơ nhôn hơmet kơ Ih tơmam sa Giĕng Năm Brih tơ yơ?”

English: And He sent out two of His disciples and said to them, “Go into the city, and a man will meet you carrying a pitcher of water; follow him.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu wơh 'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem. Sư khan: “Đơ̆ng âu biĕm mơ̆t tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem, tơ ei biĕm gô tơ'bơ̆p minh 'nu bơngai glơng ge đak na biĕm kiơ̆ hloi sư.

English: Wherever he goes in, say to the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says, “Where is the guest room in which I may eat the Passover with My disciples?” ’
Bahnar: Sư mơ̆t tơ hnam ayơ, biĕm mơ̆t kiơ̆ sư tơ noh hloi mơ̆n. Na biĕm apinh tơ'ngla hnam noh thoi âu: ‘'Bok Thây athei nhi jet ih, tơ yơ anih Sư wă sŏng sa kơ Năr Giĕng Năm Brih, lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư kư̆m wă sŏng sa hơdai hăm Sư mơ̆n?’

English: Then he will show you a large upper room, furnished and prepared; there make ready for us.”
Bahnar: Biĕm apinh sư thoi noh boih na sư gô tơ'bôh kơ biĕm minh pôm anih să tôch tơ kơpal ti, đei bơ̆n gơ'bang tang-dŏ sư hơmet lê̆ tôm boih. Na biĕm hơmet kơ bơ̆n tơmam sa tơ ei.”

English: So His disciples went out, and came into the city, and found it just as He had said to them; and they prepared the Passover.
Bahnar: Thoi noh boih na 'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư ei năm tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem 'bôh tơpă dôm tơdrong Yêsu pơkă noh hei. Na bre sư hơmet lê̆ tơmam sŏng sa kơ Năr Giĕng Năm Brih tơ ei hloi.

English: In the evening He came with the twelve.
Bahnar: Truh adrơ̆m kơsơ̆ 'năr mơ̆t boih, na Yêsu năm tơ noh hơdai păng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư.

English: Now as they sat and ate, Jesus said, “Assuredly, I say to you, one of you who eats with Me will betray Me.”
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư oei sŏng sa na Yêsu khan: “Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, đei minh 'nu lăm lu iĕm oei sŏng sa hơdai păng Inh dang ei, sư wă plơ̆ plĕch Inh.”

English: And they began to be sorrowful, and to say to Him one by one, “Is it I?” And another said, “Is it I?”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư thoi noh, na lu sư ơh sơ'ngon. Na rim 'nu lu sư kơdih kơdih jet Sư khan: “Hăm trŏ kơ inh?” Mơ'nah dơ̆ng khan: “Inh hă?”

English: He answered and said to them, “It is one of the twelve, who dips with Me in the dish.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Bơngai ei minh 'nu lăm mơjĭt-'bar 'nu lăm lu iĕm mă pơhrăm păng Inh, minh 'nu lăm lu iĕm mă chơ̆m sa 'bĕng mi tơ pơnhan đak 'nhot hơdai hăm Inh.

English: The Son of Man indeed goes just as it is written of Him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It would have been good for that man if he had never been born.”
Bahnar: Inh Kon Bơngai gô lôch 'blep trŏ thoi đe chih roi lê̆ hơdrol lăm sơ̆p hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei. Mă-lei mơnat kơ bơngai mă plơ̆ plĕch Inh noh đĕch pŭ tơdrong pơmat, 'lơ̆ng hloh đe dah lê̆ kơ tơpŭ kơ sư sơ̆.”

English: And as they were eating, Jesus took bread, blessed and broke it, and gave it to them and said, “Take, eat; this is My body.”
Bahnar: Kơplah lu sư sŏng sa Yêsu iŏk 'bĕng mi krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei na phĕ hloi 'bĕng mi noh asong kơ lu sư păng khan: “Iŏk sa 'bĕng âu bĕ, 'bĕng âu boih akâu Inh.”

English: Then He took the cup, and when He had given thanks He gave it to them, and they all drank from it.
Bahnar: Sư iŏk dơ̆ng minh pôm kơchŏk đak hơmu, krao khan bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei na ăn kơ lu sư. Klaih kơ noh đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư huch.

English: And He said to them, “This is My blood of the new covenant, which is shed for many.
Bahnar: Na Yêsu khan kơ lu sư: “Đak hơmu âu boih pham Inh wă lĕch tang ăn lơ bơngai na 'Bok Kei-Dei pơklaih tơdrong yoch lu sư.

English: Assuredly, I say to you, I will no longer drink of the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.”
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ iĕm tơpă, Inh ưh pă huch boih đak hơmu âu tơ̆p mă truh tơ năr 'Bok Kei-Dei pơgơ̆r ning-mônh 'mơ̆i, na Inh gô huch đak hơmu 'nao.”

English: And when they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.
Bahnar: Đang Sư pơma thoi noh boih lu sư hơri minh tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, lĕch năm hloi tơ kông Ôliwơ.

English: Then Jesus said to them, “All of you will be made to stumble because of Me this night, for it is written: ‘I will strike the Shepherd, And the sheep will be scattered.’
Bahnar: Na Yêsu roi kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “Đĭ-đăng kơ iĕm kơdâu achăng lê̆ Inh, yua kơ đei nơ̆r chih roi lê̆ hơdrol boih thoi âu: ‘'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơlôch tơ'ngla wei triu, triu kơdâu tơklah đơ̆ng tơ'ngla sư.’

English: “But after I have been raised, I will go before you to Galilee.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lăp 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih Inh đơ̆ng lôch, Inh năm tơ dêh Galilê hơdrol kơ iĕm.”

English: Peter said to Him, “Even if all are made to stumble, yet I will not be.”
Bahnar: Na Pêtrôs khan kơ Yêsu: “Mă đĭ lu đe âu achăng lê̆ Ih, gah inh kuă kơ achăng Ih ôh.”

English: Jesus said to him, “Assuredly, I say to you that today, even this night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny Me three times.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ sư: “Inh khan kơ ih tơpă, măng kơnh boih, hơdrol kơ iĕr ŏ 'bar 'măng, ih gô sơngah kơ Inh pêng 'măng khan ih ưh kơ băt kơ Inh.”

English: But he spoke more vehemently, “If I have to die with You, I will not deny You!” And they all said likewise.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Pêtrôs oei nŏng kơ pơjah khan kuă kơ sơngah. Sư khan: “Mă đe wă pơlôch inh hơdai hăm Ih, inh kư̆m kuă kơ sơngah ôh.” Đĭ-đăng lu bôl sư kư̆m khan lei-lăi thoi noh mơ̆n.

English: Then they came to a place which was named Gethsemane; and He said to His disciples, “Sit here while I pray.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh lu sư năm tơ anih mă đe anăn Gêtsêmanê. Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư: “Iĕm ngôi 'bơ̆t dâu. Inh wă năm krao khan kơ 'Bă Inh.”

English: And He took Peter, James, and John with Him, and He began to be troubled and deeply distressed.
Bahnar: Yêsu anhăk ba lăp pêng 'nu đĕch truh tơ anih Sư krao khan. Anăn lu pêng 'nu noh Pêtrôs, Yakơ, Yôhan. Yêsu mơ-mreh hli dêh yua kơ Sư băt kơdih wă đei tơdrong gleh truh.

English: Then He said to them, “My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here and watch.”
Bahnar: Na Sư khan kơ pêng 'nu noh: “Dang ei Inh sơ'ngon dêh dang lĕ kơ wă lôch, na iĕm ngôi 'bơ̆t dâu, kral kơchăng ngôi hơpong kơ Inh 'biơ̆ hŏ.”

English: He went a little farther, and fell on the ground, and prayed that if it were possible, the hour might pass from Him.
Bahnar: Yêsu năm ataih 'biơ̆ đơ̆ng lu pêng 'nu noh, na Sư 'nap kŭp kơ̆l krao khan apinh 'Bă Sư, dah gơh, ăn Sư klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong noh.

English: And He said, “Abba, Father, all things are possible for You. Take this cup away from Me; nevertheless, not what I will, but what You will.”
Bahnar: Sư khan: “Aba, ơ 'Bă, Ih gơh pơm tôm tơdrong. Apinh Ih ăn kơ Inh klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong gleh âu. Mă-lei Ih 'nĕ pơm kiơ̆ kơ Inh, pơm kiơ̆ kơ Ih đĕch.”

English: Then He came and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “Simon, are you sleeping? Could you not watch one hour?
Bahnar: Đang boih Sư wih tơ pêng 'nu noh 'bôh lu sư tep, na Sư khan kơ Pêtrôs: “Ơ Simôn, ih tep hă? Lơliơ ih ưh kơ gơh kral ngôi hơpong kơ Inh hơya minh jơ?

English: Watch and pray, lest you enter into temptation. The spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.”
Bahnar: Inh wă kơ iĕm kral ngôi hơpong kơ Inh păng wă kơ iĕm krao khan kơdih wă kơ iĕm huay kơ lui kơ yang Satan pơhlŭ. Inh băt kơ jơhngơ̆m đon iĕm wă ră, mă-lei akâu iĕm ưh kơ kĕ.”

English: Again He went away and prayed, and spoke the same words.
Bahnar: Yêsu năm krao khan thoi đêl dơ̆ng.

English: And when He returned, He found them asleep again, for their eyes were heavy; and they did not know what to answer Him.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Sư wih, 'bôh lu sư oei tep lei-lăi yua kơ măt lu sư trăp ưh kơ kĕ kral. Na lu sư ưh pă gơh tơl Sư thoi yơ dơ̆ng.

English: Then He came the third time and said to them, “Are you still sleeping and resting? It is enough! The hour has come; behold, the Son of Man is being betrayed into the hands of sinners.
Bahnar: Lăp Yêsu wih đơ̆ng krao khan 'măng mă pêng Sư khan kơ lu đe noh: “Iĕm oei tep pơdơh 'biơ̆ hă? Thôi, dang ei truh jơ đe wă rôp Inh Kon Bơngai jao kơ lu bơngai yoch boih.

English: Rise, let us be going. See, My betrayer is at hand.”
Bahnar: Iung bĕ, bơ̆n jah năm tơ lu sư. Iĕm lăng to, bơngai mă plơ̆ plĕch Inh wă jê̆ truh boih.”

English: And immediately, while He was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, with a great multitude with swords and clubs, came from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.
Bahnar: Kơplah Yêsu oei pơma 'bôh blư kơ Juđa truh, bơngai mă đơ̆ng lăm mơjĭt-'bar 'nu bơngai pơhrăm păng Yêsu. Đei lơ bơngai kiơ̆ sư chĕp tak đao, mơ'nah chĕp 'long tơnôn yua kơ lu 'bok soi tih, lu thây bơtho tơdrong juăt đe Juđê păng lu đe kră sek tơlang wơh lu sư năm rôp Yêsu.

English: Now His betrayer had given them a signal, saying, “Whomever I kiss, He is the One; seize Him and lead Him away safely.”
Bahnar: Juđa bơngai mă plơ̆ plĕch Yêsu, sư tơbăt ăn kơ lu bơngai mă năm rôp Yêsu thoi âu: “Bơngai mă inh chŭm, bơngai 'noh boih Yêsu; iĕm rôp anhăk Sư mă brĕ hŏ.”

English: As soon as he had come, immediately he went up to Him and said to Him, “Rabbi, Rabbi!” and kissed Him.
Bahnar: Na Juđa năm hloi tơ Yêsu păng khan: “Ơ 'Bok Thây.” Na chŭm hloi Yêsu kiơ̆ thoi đe Juđê juăt kơ kơkuh băl.

English: Then they laid their hands on Him and took Him.
Bahnar: Na lu sư tơkan rôp kơjăp Yêsu hloi.

English: And one of those who stood by drew his sword and struck the servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t ei đei minh 'nu bơngai dơ̆ng hơdai Yêsu hloch đao koh kơtĕch hloi hla đon đĭch 'bok soi tơm.

English: Then Jesus answered and said to them, “Have you come out, as against a robber, with swords and clubs to take Me?
Bahnar: Yêsu khan kơ lu bơngai mă rôp sư: “Lơliơ iĕm năm tơ âu chĕp tak đao 'long tơnôn dang lĕ đe rôp bơngai tơtông klĕ?

English: I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and you did not seize Me. But the Scriptures must be fulfilled.”
Bahnar: Bĭ rim năr Inh oei tơ tŏk-bŏk lu iĕm, bơtho iĕm tơ lăm hnam akŭm tơm, iĕm kuă kơ kiơ kơ rôp Inh tơ noh lĕ? Mă-lei tơdrong noh 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn wă kơ 'blep kơ tơdrong đe chih roi lê̆ hơdrol lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Sư sơ̆.”

English: Then they all forsook Him and fled.
Bahnar: Đang Sư pơma thoi noh bru đĭ-đăng lu bơngai pơhrăm păng Sư achăng Sư kơdâu jăk tơ nai.

English: Now a certain young man followed Him, having a linen cloth thrown around his naked body. And the young men laid hold of him
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai tơdăm kiơ̆ Yêsu, sư asu minh blah khăn kok đĕch, na lu đe ei rôp sư ră.
